helps planner leverage their domain knowledge in exploring human-scale urban form based on street view image .', 'Our system presents two-stage visual exploration : 1 ) an AOI Explorer for the visual comparison of spatial distribution and quantitative measurement in two areas-of-interest ( AOIs ) at city- and region-scales ; 2 ) and a Street Explorer with a novel parallel coordinate plot for the exploration of the fine-grained detail of the urban form at the street-scale .', 'We integrate visualization technique with machine learning model to facilitate the detection of street view pattern .', 'We illustrate the applicability of our approach with case study on the real-world datasets of four city , i.e.', ', Hong Kong , Singapore , Greater London and New York City .', 'Interview with domain expert demonstrate the effectiveness of our system in facilitating various analytical task .', 'Measuring visual enclosure for street walkability : Using machine learning algorithm and Google Street View imagery .', 'One major limitation currently with studying street level urban design quality for walkability is the often inconsistent and unreliable measure of streetscape feature across different field surveyor even with costly training due to lack of more objective process , which also make large scale study difficult .', 'The recent advance in sensor technology and digitization have produced a wealth of data to help research activity by facilitating improved measurement and conducting large scale analysis .', 'This paper explores the potential of big data and big data analytics in the light of current approach to measuring streetscape feature .', 'By applying machine learning algorithm on Google Street View imagery , we generated objectively three measure on visual enclosure .', 'The result showed that sky area were identified fairly well for the calculation of proportion of sky .', 'The three visual enclosure measure were found to be correlated with pedestrian volume and Walk Score .', 'This method allows large scale and consistent objective measure of visual enclosure that can be done reproducibly and universally applicable with readily available Google Street View imagery in many country around the world to help test their association with walking behavior .', 'On urban soundscape mapping : A computer can predict the outcome of soundscape assessment .', 'The purpose of this study was to investigate whether or not a computer may predict the outcome of soundscape assessment , based on acoustic data only .', 'It may be argued that this is impossible , because a computer lack life experience .', 'Moreover , if the computer was able to make an accurate prediction , we also wanted to know what information it needed to make this prediction .', 'We recruited 33 student ( 18 female ; Mage = 25.4 yrs.', ', SDage = 3.6 ) out of which 30 assessed how pleasant and eventful 102 unique soundscape excerpt ( 30 s ) from Stockholm were .', 'Based on the Bag of Frames approach , a Support Vector Regression learning algorithm was used to identify relationship between various acoustic feature of the acoustic signal and perceived affective quality .', 'We found that the Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients provided strong prediction for both Pleasantness ( R2 = 0.74 ) and Eventfulness ( R2 = 0.83 ) .', 'This model performed better than the average individual in the experiment in term of internal consistency of individual assessment .', 'Taken together , the result show that a computer can predict the outcome of soundscape assessment , which is promising for future soundscape mapping .', 'Procedural urban environment for FPS game .', 'This paper presents a novel approach to procedural generation of urban map for First Person Shooter ( FPS ) game .', 'A multi-agent evolutionary system is employed to place street , building and other item inside the Unity3D game engine , resulting in playable video game level .', 'A computational agent is trained using machine learning technique to capture the intent of the game designer as part of the multi-agent system , and to enable a semi-automated aesthetic selection for the underlying genetic algorithm .', 'Capturing impression of pedestrian landscape used for healing purpose with decision tree learning .', 'In 2002 , Medicare health insurance recognized the relationship between pedestrian environment and public health by providing co-pay for health care delivered in residential land use .', 'In this multi-disciplinary experiment , artificial intelligence ( AI ) and landscape architecture ( LA ) bridge their respective domain to measure and model the pedestrian reaction to walking environment in small town residential community in Central Texas .', 'In the process , we gained a deeper understanding of the health motivation of walker and their empirical relationship to various street environment that they used for health purpose .', "The analytical model we ultimately developed is a flexible tool that facilitates exploration of people 's perception of the landscape , how the pedestrian landscape are functioning in the opinion of its user , and how change to the design of the walking domain may predictably affect physical activity level with the associated health benefit .", 'A pilot study involving fifty-four participant and six walking environment were used in the development of an analytical model that is significantly site-specific and grass root oriented .', "Participant perception were measured querying each participant 's rating of fifty discrete environmental variable taken .", 'This data was then analyzed using the decision tree algorithm .', 'Our primary objective was to capture the decision-making pattern walker engage in when deciding to walk in a particular environment specifically for health purpose and to make this available to the designer of pedestrian environment in transportation corridor .', "The approach gave the designer new insight into the critical variable and the not so critical variable that affected people 's decision to walk for health purpose .", 'The result from the analysis defined measurable environmental variable that form the design for pedestrian activity in the six walking environment in the study area .', 'A customized version of decision tree machine learning algorithm rule for designing good pedestrian landscape for health purpose were extracted from the grass root survey .', 'The data indicated that variable influencing the decision to walk for health purpose in the study area included weather , sound , water , light and edge of space .', 'The analytical model derived from the discipline of artificial intelligence facilitated examining a subset of variable and manipulating of individual or group of these variable to better understand how the built environment affected decision to walk for different purpose .', 'This collaboration was our first phase in developing intelligent tool for designer that provided site-specific user-specific data to the planner or designer of pedestrian space .']

['Quantifying physical and psychological perception of urban scene using deep learning .', 'The complicated relationship between urban scene and public perception has long been a concern in many discipline .', 'Previous study have lacked human-oriented technical path and high-throughput datasets to quantify physical and psychological perception in different land-use scenario .', 'This paper adopts a novel transfer learning approach to quantify the six type of landsense index ( LSIs ) as psychological perception metric and employs panoptic segmentation to parameterize the view index ( VI ) and the number of foreground instance ( NFIs ) as physical perception measure .', "Then , a quantitative analysis is conducted in Beijing 's six Ring Road area , and the connection between people 's physical and psychological perception of heterogeneous land use are explored .", 'The landsense map can depict the distribution of LSIs and facilitate the understanding of complex perception distributed at a large scale .', 'The regression model shows that natural landscape ( tree , grass , and mountain ) in the Beijing built-up area exhibit an overall positive performance .', 'Moreover , for several block-level land us , industrial scenery is related to overall negative psychological feeling .', 'Park and green space are positively related to psychological perception , because of the greater exposure opportunity to natural landscape for resident .', 'The framework in this research has potential in assisting urban planning and land-use management , and it enriches the datasets with extensive information , thereby improving the psychological perception of urban scene from resident ’ perspective .', 'The novel approach in this paper take a step forward in quantifying and understanding the public perception of urban landscape .', 'Subjectively measured streetscape perception to inform urban design strategy for Shanghai .', 'Recently , many new study applying computer vision ( CV ) to street view imagery ( SVI ) datasets to objectively extract the view index of various streetscape feature such as tree to proxy urban scene quality have emerged .', 'However , human perception ( e.g.', ', imageability ) have a subtle relationship to visual element that can not be fully captured using view index .', 'Conversely , subjective measure using survey and interview data explain human behavior more .', 'However , the effectiveness of integrating subjective measure with SVI datasets has been less discussed .', 'To address this , we integrated crowdsourcing , CV , and machine learning ( ML ) to subjectively measure four important perception suggested by classical urban design theory .', 'We first collected rating from expert on sample SVIs regarding these four quality , which became the training label .', 'CV segmentation was applied to SVI sample extracting streetscape view index as the explanatory variable .', 'We then trained ML model and achieved high accuracy in predicting score .', 'We found a strong correlation between the predicted complexity score and the density of urban amenity and service point of interest ( POI ) , which validates the effectiveness of subjective measure .', 'In addition , to test the generalizability of the proposed framework as well as to inform urban renewal strategy , we compared the measured quality in Pudong to other five urban core that are renowned worldwide .', 'Rather than predicting perceptual score directly from generic image feature using a convolution neural network , our approach follows what urban design theory has suggested and confirmed as various streetscape feature affecting multi-dimensional human perception .', 'Therefore , the result provide more interpretable and actionable implication for policymakers and city planner .', 'Evolution of historical urban landscape with computer vision and machine learning : A case study of Berlin .', 'Previous study of historical urban landscape usually focused on the qualitative analysis of city planning and development with the social , economic , and political context , but overlooked quantitative analysis from human perception .', 'In this study , we objectively measured the seemingly subjective quality of the eye-level urban landscape perception with computer vision and machine learning technology .', 'We then explored correlation between the measured perceptual quality and characteristic from the historical context .', 'We chose Berlin as a research object because it is a capital city that owns a rich history of division and reunification , as well as a variety of residential zone built at different period .', 'We extracted 30 street feature from the 150,000 Google Street View Imagery ( SVI ) dataset with a computer vision algorithm and evaluated eight perceptual quality including typology , order , ecology , enclosure , aesthetic , richness , accessibility and scale with a machine learning method .', 'Then we defined seven residential district in Berlin , according to their spatial distribution and construction period .', 'Through a systematic comparison of perceptual quality of the seven residential district , we find perceptual quality of ecology and enclosure have been improved a lot over a hundred year in Berlin .', 'The housing policy and design code in different social , economic and political contexts evolved to end overcrowding living condition , create more open space , and develop a better ecological environment .', 'This study enriches our understanding and application of subjective measure of human-centred built environment perception to the evolution of the historical urban landscape .', 'The proposed quantitative framework of subjective human perception measure provides great testimony to evaluate the effect of the implementation of housing and other urban planning policy .', 'Such an automated , multisource , high-throughput and scalable framework can be applied to other city to determine the personality of the city and assess the impact of urban design and planning policy in streetscape improvement .', 'Making a New City Image .', 'This paper explores the application of computer vision and machine learning to street- level imagery of city , reevaluating past theory linking urban form to human perception .', "This paper further proposes a new method for design based on the resulting model , where a designer can identify area of a city tied to certain perceptual quality and generate speculative street scene optimized for their predicted saliency on label of human experience.This work extends Kevin Lynch 's Image of the City with deep learning : training an image classification model to recognize Lynch 's five element of the city image , using Lynch 's original photographs and diagram of Boston to construct labeled training data alongside new imagery of the same location .", 'This new city image revitalizes past attempt to quantify the human perception of urban form and improve urban design .', 'A designer can search and map the data set to understand spatial opportunity and predict the quality of imagined design through a dynamic process of collage , model inference , and adaptation.Within a larger practice of design , this work suggests that the curation of archival record , computer science technique , and theoretical principle of urbanism might be integrated into a single craft .', "With a new city image , designer might `` see '' at the scale of the city , as well as focus on the texture , color , and detail of urban life .", 'Anxious Landscapes .', 'Advance in the field of machine learning over the last decade have revolutionized artificial intelligence by providing a flexible means to build analytic , predictive , and generative model from large datasets .', 'but the allied design discipline have yet to apply these tool at the urban level to draw analytic insight on how the built environment might impact human health .', 'Previous research has found numerous correlation between the built environment and both physical and mental health outcomes-suggesting that the design of our city may have significant impact on human health .', 'Developing method of analysis that can provide insight on the correlation between the built environment and human health could help the allied design discipline shape our city in way that promote human health .', 'This research addresses these issue and contributes knowledge on the use of deep learning ( DL ) method for urban analysis and mental health , specifically anxiety .', 'Mental health disorder , such as anxiety , have been estimated to account for the largest proportion of global disease burden .', 'The method presented allow architect , planner , and urban designer to make use of large remote-sensing datasets ( e.g .. satellite and aerial image ) for design workflow involving analysis and generative design task .', 'The research also contributes insight on correlation between anxiety prevalence and specific urban design features-providing actionable intelligence for the planning and design of the urban fabric .', 'An investigation of the visual feature of urban street vitality using a convolutional neural network .', 'As a well-known urban landscape concept to describe urban space quality , urban street vitality is a subjective human perception of the urban environment but difficult to evaluate directly from the physical space .', 'The study utilized a modern machine learning computer vision algorithm in the urban build environment to simulate the process , which starts with the visual perception of the urban street landscape and ends with the human reaction to street vitality .', 'By analyzing the optimized trained model , we tried to identify urban street vitality ’ s visual feature and evaluate their importance .', 'A region around the Mochou Lake in Nanjing , China , was set as our study area .', 'Seven investigator surveyed the area , recorded their evaluation score on each site ’ s vitality level with a corresponding picture taken on site .', 'A total of 370 picture and recorded score pair from 231 valid survey site were used to train a convolutional neural network .', 'After optimization , a deep neural network model with 43 layer , including 11 convolutional one , was created .', 'Heat map were then used to identify the feature which lead to high vitality score output .', 'The spatial distribution of different type of feature entity were also analyzed to help identify the spatial effect .', 'The study found that visual feature , including human , construction site , shop front , and roadside/walking pavement , are vital one that correspond to the vitality of the urban street .', 'The consistency of these critical feature with traditional urban vitality feature indicates the model had learned useful knowledge from the training process .', 'Applying the trained model in urban planning practice can help to improve the city environment for better attraction of resident ’ activity and communication .', 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', 'A human-machine adversarial scoring framework for urban perception assessment using street-view image .', 'Though global-coverage urban perception datasets have been recently created using machine learning , their efficacy in accurately assessing local urban perception for other country and region remains a problem .', 'Here we describe a human-machine adversarial scoring framework using a methodology that incorporates deep learning and iterative feedback with recommendation score , which allows for the rapid and cost-effective assessment of the local urban perception for Chinese city .', 'Using the state-of-the-art Fully Convolutional Network ( FCN ) and Random Forest ( RF ) algorithms , the proposed method provides perception estimation with error less than 10 % .', 'The driving factor analysis from both the visual and urban functional aspect demonstrated its feasibility in facilitating local urban perception derivation .', 'With high-throughput and high-accuracy scoring , the proposed human-machine adversarial framework offer an affordable and rapid solution for urban planner and researcher to conduct local urban perception assessment .', 'The visual quality of street : A human-centred continuous measurement based on machine learning algorithms and street view image .', 'This study proposes a workable approach for quantitatively measuring the perceptual-based visual quality of street , which has often relied on subjective impression or feeling .', 'With the help of recently emerged street view image and machine learning algorithms , an evaluation model has been trained to assess the perceived visual quality with accuracy similar to that of experienced urban designer , to provide full coverage and detailed result for a citywide area .', 'The town centre of Shanghai was selected for the site .', 'Around 140,000 screenshots from Baidu Street View were processed and a machine learning algorithm , SegNet , was applied to intelligently extract the pixel representing key element affecting the visual quality of street , including the building frontage , greenery , sky view , pedestrian space , motorisation , and diversity .', 'A Java-based program was then produced to automatically collect the preference of experienced urban designer on representative sample image .', 'Another machine learning algorithm , i.e .', 'an artificial neural network , was used to train an evaluation model to achieve a citywide , high-resolution evaluation of the visual quality of the street .', 'Further validation through different approach shows this evaluation model obtains a satisfactory accuracy .', 'The result from the artificial neural network also help to explore the high or low effect of various key element on visual quality .', 'In short , this study contributes to the development of human-centred planning and design by providing continuous measurement of an ‘ unmeasurable ’ quality across large-scale area .', 'Meanwhile , insight on the perceptual-based visual quality and detailed mapping of various key element in street can assist in more efficient street renewal by providing accurate design guidance .', 'Measuring human perception of a large-scale urban region using machine learning .', 'Measuring the human sense of place and quantifying the connection among the visual feature of the built environment that impact the human sense of place have long been of interest to a wide variety of field .', 'Previous study have relied on low-throughput survey and limited data source , which have difficulty in measuring the human perception of a large-scale urban region at flexible spatial resolution .', 'In this work , a data-driven machine learning approach is proposed to measure how people perceive a place in a large-scale urban region .', 'Specifically , a deep learning model , which has been trained on million of human rating of street-level imagery , was used to predict human perception of a street view image .', 'The model achieved a high accuracy rate in predicting six human perceptual indicator , namely , safe , lively , beautiful , wealthy , depressing , and boring .', 'This model can help to map the distribution of the city-wide human perception for a new urban region .', 'Furthermore , a series of statistical analysis was conducted to determine the visual element that may cause a place to be perceived as different perception .', 'From the 150 object category segmented from the street view image , various object were identified as being positively or negatively correlated with each of the six perceptual indicator .', 'The result take researcher and urban planner one step toward understanding the interaction of the place sentiment and semantics .', 'Holistic visual data representation for built environment assessment .', 'With an increasing interest of big data and its analysis , urban planner and architect use manifold data from different source as an indicator of urban phenomenon .', 'To analyse them , machine learning model have been gotten fame to evaluate complex urban feature with correlation matrix and cross validation .', 'There are two major type of data such as top-down and bottom-up data .', "Interestingly , there is a third category of data that has not been widely deployed yet which we define as the 'Holistic visual data ' .", 'It is the general impression to your visual perception of urban environment when you at a specific spot that we believe can be captured by Google Street Views .', 'This paper aims to ask how do top-down , bottomup , and holistic visual data work individually or together to predict the built environment value in urban area .', "Admittedly , housing price is a highly spatial metric that involves multifarious interest including macroeconomic policy , the development of the area , the local people , and specific house ' feature .", 'To investigate the quality of built environment , machine learning technique are adopted for different group of datasets .', 'By comparing several regression and classification model for each group of data such as top-down , bottom-up and holistic visual data with housing price , the Random Forest model could be proposed as a best model .', 'The intricate urban matrix need to be organized such an order , but there are multiple factor affecting urban issue including land value and housing price .', 'By utilizing relevant machine learning model , it can be provided the practical guideline to architect and designer for improving the quality of built environment .', 'A machine learning-based method for the large-scale evaluation of the quality of the urban environment .', 'Given the present size of modern city , it is beyond the perceptual capacity of most people to develop a good knowledge about the quality of the urban space at every street corner .', 'Correspondingly , for planner , it is also difficult to accurately answer question such as ‘ where the quality of the physical environment is the most dilapidated in the city that regeneration should be given first consideration ’ and ‘ in fast urbanising city , how is the city appearance changing ’ .', 'To address this issue , in the present study , we present a computer vision method that contains three machine learning model for the large-scale and automatic evaluation on the quality of the urban environment by leveraging state-of-the-art machine learning technique and wide-coverage street view image .', 'From various physical quality that have been identified by previous research to be important for the urban visual experience , we choose two key quality , the construction and maintenance quality of building facade and the continuity of street wall , to be measured in this research .', 'To test the validity of the proposed method , we compare the machine scores with public rating score collected on-site from 752 passers-by at 56 location in the city .', "We show that the machine learning model can produce a medium-to-good estimation of people 's real experience , and the modelling result can be applied in many way by researcher , planner and local resident ."]

['Measuring heterogeneous perception of urban space with massive data and machine learning : An application to safety .', 'In the last decade , large street imagery data set and machine learning development have allowed increasing scalability of methodology to understand the effect of landscape attribute on the way they are perceived .', 'However , these new methodology have not incorporated individual heterogeneity in their analysis , even though difference by gender and other sociodemographic characteristic in the perception of safety and other aspect of landscape and public space have been widely studied in social science and urban planning in lower scale study .', 'In the present study , we combine computational and statistical tool to develop a methodological proposal with high scalability and low implementation cost , which helps to identify and measure heterogeneous perception and its correlation to the presence of element in the landscape .', 'To achieve this , we implement a survey of perception of public space , collecting sociodemographic information of respondent .', 'Then , we fit a discrete choice model to quantify perception of these space using a parametrization of image that jointly considers semantic segmentation and object detection as input .', "Our result show heterogeneity in the perception of safety in public space according to gender and the observer 's habitual mobility choice .", 'The model is then applied to the city of Santiago , Chile .', 'This produces a map of safety perception for different type of user .', 'The proposed method and the obtained result can be a relevant input for the design of public space and decision making in the urban planning process .', 'Towards Participatory Design of City Soundscapes .', 'Sonic environment of fast-growing urban area are an integral part of the quality of our everyday living in city .', 'Due to the individual nature of the sonic experience , collecting and analyzing such experience need method for gathering accurate and useful data about them .', 'This paper describes how to incorporate the concept of soundscape into city planning process .', 'To achieve this , we propose creating participatory method for gathering data from the citizen so that the data would be useful and relevant for the city planning professional .', 'Since the participatory planning process aim at in evolving the citizen , we suggest method that utilize crowdsourcing , mobile technology and machine learning for presenting , workshopping , and designing soundscapes in the city context .', 'Investigating sense of place of the Las Vegas Strip using online review and machine learning approach .', 'Public space is essential to urban public life , activity , and event , and has become a key component of design and regeneration scheme .', 'However , visitor ’ experience of public space and the subsequent perception and sense of place are often difficult to measure because of its intangible nature and the expensive data collection process .', 'This study collected 20,476 online review from 18,387 Tripadvisor user from 2008 to 2019 to understand how visitor experience and react to the public space on the Las Vegas Strip .', 'We effectively elicited sense of place on the Las Vegas Strip and quantified the popularity and sentiment of each sense of place facet with Latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) and logistic regression machine learning method .', 'The result specified 30 distinct topic related to the Strip , among which the most important one were exploring different hotel , night scene , people watching , and walking long distance .', 'The visitor experience explored within this study uncovered multiple facet of sense of place on the Strip and suggested urban design strategy and public space management policy related to the programmatic and physical element of the Strip sidewalk .', 'The study shows how online review can provide strong empirical evidence for visitor experience in built environment project .', 'This approach can be used by landscape architect , urban planner , and policy maker on post-occupancy evaluation and guide redevelopment effort to provide a full feedback loop .', 'A LARGE SCALE CLASSIFICATION of PUBLIC SPACES USING A STUDY of PERCEPTION and PUBLIC DATA from INEGI of the CITY of PUEBLA , SAN PEDRO CHOLULA and SAN ANDRES CHOLULA .', 'This work aims to create a methodology to automatize the classification of public space using a perception test and data obtained from city census information , in our case , from the Mexican National Institute of Statistics and Geography ( INEGI ) .', 'Nowadays there is no well defined process in decision making when planning the creation or development of public space .', 'For this reason , a study to measure the human perception was made in order to gather data about what people perceived about five variable : architectural beauty , pollution , fun , wealth and safety .', 'The information obtained was used to create a Machine learning model that could find a relation between the perception obtained and the census dataset .', 'This first attempt aim to find key insight needed to develop a more complex methodology to classify , at a greater scale , public place in term of their safety or architectural value and which socio-demographic data defines this perception .', 'The Social Life of Small Urban Spaces 2.0 : Three Experiment in Computational Urban Studies .', 'This paper introduces a novel framework for urban analysis that leverages computational technique , along with established urban research method , to study how people use urban public space .', 'Through three case study in different urban location in Europe and the US , it demonstrates how recent machine learning and computer vision technique may assist us in producing unprecedently detailed portrait of the relative influence of urban and environmental variable on people ’ s use of public space .', 'The paper further discusses the potential of this framework to enable empirically-enriched form of urban and social analysis with application in urban planning , design , research , and policy .', 'Explaining subjective perception of public space as a function of the built environment : A massive data approach .', "People 's perception of the built environment influence the way they use and navigate it .", 'Understanding these perception may be useful to inform the design , management and planning process of public space .', 'Recently , several study have used data collected at a massive scale and machine learning method to quantify these perception , showing promising result in term of predictive performance .', 'Nevertheless , most of these model can be of little help in understanding user ’ perception due to the difficulty associated with identifying the importance of each attribute of landscape .', 'In this work , we propose a novel approach to quantify perception of landscape through discrete choice model , using semantic segmentation of image of public space , generated through machine learning algorithms , as explanatory variable .', 'The proposed model are estimated using the Place Pulse dataset , with over 1.2 million perceptual indicator , and are able to provide useful insight into how user perceive the built environment as a function of its feature .', 'The model obtained are used to infer perceptual variable in the city of Santiago , Chile , and show they have a significant correlation with socioeconomic indicator .', 'Urban multisensory laboratory , an approach to model urban space human perception .', 'An urban sensory lab ( USL or LUS an acronym in Spanish ) is a new and avant-garde approach for studying and analyzing a city .', 'The construction of this approach allows the development of new methodology to identify the emotional response of public space user .', 'The laboratory combine qualitative analysis proposed by urbanists and quantitative measure managed by data analysis application .', 'USL is a new approach to go beyond the border of urban knowledge .', 'The design thinking strategy allows us to implement method to understand the result provided by our technique .', 'In this first approach , the interpretation is made by hand .', 'However , our goal is to combine design thinking and machine learning in order to analyze the qualitative and quantitative data automatically .', 'Now , the result are being used by student from the Urbanism and Architecture course in order to get a better understanding of public space in Puebla , Mexico and its interaction with people .', 'CC BY 4.0 License .', 'Multiple image of the city : Unveiling group-specific urban perception through a crowdsourcing game .', 'Our perception of public space are central for our experience in the city .', 'Understanding which factor shape this perception informs both urban planner , that aim at improving city life , as well as computational model that help us navigate in urban space .', "To understand city at scale , crowdsourcing game have been employed successfully to evaluate citizen ' opinion about city and urban scene .", 'By analyzing human perception from resident of a mid-sized Brazilian city , this work brings three novel contribution .', 'First , we consider theory from urban design to explore through crowdsourcing which high and low level feature in an urban space are linked to perception of safety and pleasantness .', 'Secondly , this paper leverages theory from urban sociology and anthropology to show how the sociodemographic pro.le of the citizen signi.cantly mediate their perception of safeness and pleasantness of place .', 'Finally , we show that feature of the urban form proposed by urbanists can be combined with sociodemographics to improve the accuracy of machine learning model that predict which scene a person will .nd more safe or pleasant .', '.is last result paves the road for more personalized recommendation in cold-start scenario .', 'Feature extraction and k-means clustering approach to explore important feature of urban identity .', 'Public spaces play an important role in the process of formation , generation and change of urban identity .', 'Under present day condition , the identity of city are rapidly deteriorating and vanishing .', 'Therefore , the importance of urban design , which is a means of designing urban space and their physical and social aspect , is ever growing .', 'This paper proposes a novel methodology by using Principle Component Analysis ( PCA ) and K-means clustering approach to find important feature of the urban identity from public space .', "K. Lynch 's work and Space Syntax theory are reconstructed and integrated with POI ( Point of Interest ) to quantify the quality of the public space .", 'A case study of Zürich city is used to test of these redefinition and feature of urban identity .', 'The result show that PCA and K-means clustering approach can identify the urban identity and explore important feature .', 'This strategy could help to improve planning and design process and generation of new urban pattern with more appropriate feature and quality .', 'Concept of interactive machine learning in urban design problem .', 'This work presents a concept of interactive machine learning in a human design process .', 'An urban design problem is viewed as a multiple-criteria optimization problem .', 'The outlined feature of an urban design problem is the dependence of a design goal on a context of the problem .', 'We model the design goal as a randomized fitness measure that depends on the context .', 'In term of multiple-criteria decision analysis ( MCDA ) , the defined measure corresponds to a subjective expected utility of a user .', 'In the first stage of the proposed approach we let the algorithm explore a design space using clustering technique .', "The second stage is an interactive design loop ; the user makes a proposal , then the program optimizes it , gets the user 's feedback and return back the control over the application interface ."]

['Comparison of DEM Super-Resolution Methods Based on Interpolation and Neural Networks .', 'High-resolution digital elevation model ( DEMs ) play a critical role in geospatial database , which can be applied to many terrain-related study such as facility siting , hydrological analysis , and urban design .', 'However , due to the limitation of precision of equipment , there are big gap to collect high-resolution DEM data .', 'A practical idea is to recover high-resolution DEMs from easily obtained low-resolution DEMs , and this process is termed DEM super-resolution ( SR ) .', 'However , traditional DEM SR method ( e.g.', ', bicubic interpolation ) tend to over-smooth high-frequency region on account of the operation of averaging local variation .', 'With the recent development of machine learning , image SR method have made great progress .', 'Nevertheless , due to the complexity of terrain character ( e.g.', ', peak and valley ) and the huge difference between elevation field and image RGB ( Red , Green , and Blue ) value field , there are few work that apply image SR method to the task of DEM SR .', 'Therefore , this paper investigates the question of whether the state-of-the-art image SR method are appropriate for DEM SR. More specifically , the traditional interpolation method and three excellent SR method based on neural network are chosen for comparison .', 'Experimental result suggest that SRGAN ( Super-Resolution with Generative Adversarial Network ) presents the best performance on accuracy evaluation over a series of DEM SR experiment .', 'SNLRUX++ for Building Extraction from High-Resolution Remote Sensing Images .', 'Building extraction plays an important role in high-resolution remote sensing image processing , which can be used as the basis for urban planning and demographic analysis .', 'In recent year , many powerful general semantic segmentation model have emerged , but these model often perform poorly when transferred to remote sensing image because of the characteristic of remote sensing image .', 'To this end , we propose a new deep learning network called Selective Nonlocal ResUNeXt++ ( SNLRUX++ ) for building extraction .', 'First , the cascaded multiscale feature fusion is proposed to transform the high-performance image classification network ResNeXt into the segmentation network ResUNeXt++ .', 'Second , selective nonlocal operation is designed to establish long-range dependency while avoiding introducing excessive noise and computational effort .', 'Finally , multiscale prediction is applied as deep supervision to accelerate training and convergence , and improves prediction performance of object at different scale .', 'The experimental result on two different remote sensing image datasets show the effectiveness and generalization ability of the proposed method .', 'DSA-Net : A novel deeply supervised attention-guided network for building change detection in high-resolution remote sensing image .', 'Building change detection ( BCD ) plays a crucial role in urban planning and development and has received extensive attention .', 'However , existing deep learning-based change detection method suffer from limited accuracy , mainly due to the information loss and inadequate capability in feature extraction .', 'To overcome these shortcoming , we propose a novel deeply supervised attention-guided network ( DSA-Net ) for BCD task in high-resolution image .', "In the DSA-Net , we innovatively introduce a spatial attention mechanism-guided cross-layer addition and skip-connection ( CLA-Con-SAM ) module to aggregate multi-level contextual information , weaken the heterogeneity between raw image feature and difference feature , and direct the network 's attention to changed region .", 'We also introduce an atrous spatial pyramid pooling ( ASPP ) module to extract multi-scale feature .', 'To further improve detection performance , we implement a new deep supervision module to enhance the ability of middle layer to extract more distinctive feature .', 'We conduct quantitative and qualitative experiment on the two publicly available datasets , i.e.', ', the LEVIR-CD and the WHU Building datasets .', 'Compared with the competing method , the proposed DSA-Net achieves the best performance in all evaluation metric .', 'The efficiency analysis reveals that the proposed DSA-Net achieves a great balance between BCD performance and complexity/efficiency , with faster convergence and higher robustness .', 'GAN-Based Semisupervised Scene Classification of Remote Sensing Image .', 'With the advent of a large number of remote sensing image ( RSIs ) , scene classification of RSI is widely applied to many field such as urban planning , natural disaster detection , and environmental monitoring .', 'Compared with the natural image field , the lack of labeled RSI is a bottleneck of supervised scene classification method based on deep learning .', 'Meanwhile , unsupervised scene classification is difficult to meet actual need .', 'To this end , we propose a novel semisupervised scene classification method for RSI using generative adversarial net ( GANs ) , in which a gating unit , a self-attention gating ( SAG ) module , and a pretrained Inception V3 branch are introduced into discriminative network to enhance the feature representation capability for facilitating semisupervised classification .', 'To be specific , the gating unit aims to learn the weight of each feature map and capture the dependence relationship between feature .', 'The SAG module aim to capture a long-range dependence for adaptively focusing on important scene region .', 'The Inception V3 branch aim to extract the high-level semantic representation of input image and further enhance the discriminant ability by gating unit and SAG module .', 'Furthermore , a new optimization term is incorporated into the generator loss to indirectly drive discriminator to correctly classify scene image .', 'To verify the effectiveness of the proposed method , extensive experimental result on UC Merced and EuroSAT data set demonstrate that the method surpasses most of the state-of-the-art semisupervised image classification method significantly , especially when only few sample are tagged .', 'GeoAI in terrain analysis : Enabling multi-source deep learning and data fusion for natural feature detection .', 'In this paper we report on a new GeoAI research method which enables deep machine learning from multi-source geospatial data for natural feature detection .', 'In particular , a multi-source , deep learning-based object detection pipeline was developed .', 'This pipeline introduces three new feature : First , strategy of both data-level fusion ( i.e.', ', channel expansion on convolutional neural network ) and feature-level fusion were integrated into the object detection model to allow simultaneous machine learning from multi-source data , including remote sensing imagery and Digital Elevation Model ( DEM ) data .', 'Second , a new data fusion strategy was developed to blend DEM data and its derivative to create a new , fused data source with enriched information content and image feature .', 'The model has also enabled deep learning by combining both the proposed data fusion and feature-level fusion strategy to yield a much-improved detection result .', 'Third , two different set of data augmentation technique were applied to the multi-source training data to further improve the model performance .', 'A series of experiment were conducted to verify the effectiveness of the proposed strategy in multi-source deep learning .', 'Multi-class strategy for joint building footprint and road detection in remote sensing .', 'Building footprint and road network are important input for a great deal of service .', 'For instance , building map are useful for urban planning , whereas road map are essential for disaster response service .', 'Traditionally , building and road map are manually generated by remote sensing expert or land surveying , occasionally assisted by semi-automatic tool .', 'In the last decade , deep learning-based approach have demonstrated their capability to extract these element automatically and accurately from remote sensing imagery .', 'The building footprint and road network detection problem can be considered a multi-class semantic segmentation task , that is , a single model performs a pixel-wise classification on multiple class , optimizing the overall performance .', 'However , depending on the spatial resolution of the imagery used , both class may coexist within the same pixel , drastically reducing their separability .', 'In this regard , binary decomposition technique , which have been widely studied in the machine learning literature , are proved useful for addressing multiclass problem .', 'Accordingly , the multi-class problem can be split into multiple binary semantic segmentation sub-problems , specializing different model for each class .', 'Nevertheless , in these case , an aggregation step is required to obtain the final output label .', 'Additionally , other novel approach , such as multi-task learning , may come in handy to further increase the performance of the binary semantic segmentation model .', 'Since there is no certainty as to which strategy should be carried out to accurately tackle a multi-class remote sensing semantic segmentation problem , this paper performs an in-depth study to shed light on the issue .', 'For this purpose , open-access Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 imagery ( at 10 m ) are considered for extracting building and road , making use of the well-known U-Net convolutional neural network .', 'It is worth stressing that building and road class may coexist within the same pixel when working at such a low spatial resolution , setting a challenging problem scheme .', 'Accordingly , a robust experimental study is developed to assess the benefit of the decomposition strategy and their combination with a multi-task learning scheme .', 'The obtained result demonstrate that decomposing the considered multi-class remote sensing semantic segmentation problem into multiple binary one using a One-vs-All binary decomposition technique leads to better result than the standard direct multi-class approach .', 'Additionally , the benefit of using a multi-task learning scheme for pushing the performance of binary segmentation model are also shown .', 'Automatic detection of impervious surface from remotely sensed data using deep learning .', 'The large scale quantification of impervious surface provides valuable information for urban planning and socioeconomic development .', 'Remote sensing and GIS technique provide spatial and temporal information of land surface and are widely used for modeling impervious surface .', 'Traditionally , these surface are predicted by computing statistical index derived from different band available in remotely sensed data , such as the Landsat and Sentinel series .', 'More recently , researcher have explored classification and regression technique to model impervious surface .', 'However , these modeling effort are limited due to lack of labeled data for training and evaluation .', 'This in turn requires significant effort for manual labeling of data and visual interpretation of result .', 'In this paper , we train deep learning neural network using TensorFlow to predict impervious surface from Landsat 8 image .', 'We used OpenStreetMap ( OSM ) , a crowd-sourced map of the world with manually interpreted impervious surface such as road and building , to programmatically generate large amount of training and evaluation data , thus overcoming the need for manual labeling .', 'We conducted extensive experimentation to compare the performance of different deep learning neural network architecture , optimization method , and the set of feature used to train the network .', 'The four model configuration labeled U-net_sgd_bands , U-net_adam_bands , U-Net_Adam_Bands+SI , and VGG-19_Adam_Bands+SI resulted in a root mean squared error ( RMSE ) of 0.1582 , 0.1358 , 0.1375 , and 0.1582 and an accuracy of 90.87 % , 92.28 % , 92.46 % , and 90.11 % , respectively , on the test set .', 'The U-Net_Adam_Bands+SI Model , similar to the others mentioned above , is a deep learning neural network that combines Landsat 8 band with statistical index .', 'This model performs the best among all four on statistical accuracy and produces qualitatively sharper and brighter prediction of impervious surface as compared to the other model .', 'Comparing three machine learning technique for building extraction from a digital surface model .', 'Automatic building extraction from high-resolution remotely sensed data is a major area of interest for an extensive range of field ( e.g.', ', urban planning , environmental risk management ) but challenging due to urban morphology complexity .', 'Among the different method proposed , the approach based on supervised machine learning ( ML ) achieve the best result .', 'This paper aims to investigate building footprint extraction using only high-resolution raster digital surface model ( DSM ) data by comparing the performance of three different popular supervised ML model on a benchmark dataset .', 'The first two method rely on a histogram of oriented gradient ( HOG ) feature descriptor and a classical ML ( support vector machine ( SVM ) ) or a shallow neural network ( extreme learning machine ( ELM ) ) classifier , and the third model is a fully convolutional network ( FCN ) based on deep learning with transfer learning .', 'Used data were obtained from the International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing ( ISPRS ) and cover the urban area of Vaihingen an der Enz , Potsdam , and Toronto .', 'The result indicated that performance of model based on shallow ML ( feature extraction and classifier training ) are affected by the urban context investigated ( F1 scores from 0.49 to 0.81 ) , whereas the FCN-based model proved to be the most robust and best-performing method for building extraction from a high-resolution raster DSM ( F1 scores from 0.80 to 0.86 ) .', '3D urban change detection with point cloud siamese network .', 'As the majority of the earth population is living in urban environment , city are continuously evolving and efficient monitoring tool are needed to retrieve and classify their evolution .', 'In this context , analysing change between two date is a crucial point .', 'In urban environment , most change occur along the vertical axis ( with new construction or demolition of building ) and the use of 3D data is therefore mandatory .', 'Among them , LiDAR constitutes a valuable source of information .', 'However , With the difficulty of processing sparse and unordered 3D point cloud , most of existing method start by rasterizing point cloud ( for example to Digital Surface Models ) before using more conventional image processing tool .', 'This implies a significant loss of information .', 'Among existing study dealing directly with point cloud , and to the best of our knowledge , no deep neural network-based method has been explored yet .', 'Thus , in order to fill this gap and to test the ability of deep method to deal with change detection and characterization of 3D point cloud , we propose a Siamese network with Kernel Point Convolution inspired by Siamese architecture that have already shown their performance on change detection in 2D image and on KPConv network which achieves high-quality result for semantic segmentation of raw 3D point cloud .', 'We show quantitatively and qualitatively that our method outperforms by more than 25 % ( in term of average Intersection over Union for class of change ) existing machine learning method based on hand-crafted feature .', 'Machine Learning Methods for Road Edge Detection on Fused Airborne Hyperspectral and LIDAR Data .', 'In the last decade , remote sensing sensor , such as hyperspectral system or LiDAR scanner , have been used for urban mapping .', 'However , an analysis in the urban environment is very complex in application , e.g.', ', road detection , city management , and urban planning .', 'One of the important urban feature is the detection of the road edges .', 'In this study , an approach on multisensory hyperspectral and LiDAR data fusion ( HL-Fusion ) is introduced for road edge detection using different machine learning algorithms , such as Support Vector Machines , Random Forests , and Convolutional Neural Networks .', "The first result show that the Random Forest algorithm outperformed in the experiment on the study area at Oslo 's surroundings in Norway .", 'This study opens a window for further investigation on machine learning algorithms and a better understanding of HL-Fusion capability .', 'A study on vehicle detection through aerial image : Various challenge , issue and application .', 'Nowadays vehicle detection and counting at the border of country , as well as states/cities , has become popular through aerial image because of security concern .', 'It will play a vital role to reduce the various crime i.e .', '( child kidnapping , drug/alcohol smuggling , traffic misconduct , weapon smuggling , sexual misconduct and mission of country-related crime , etc . )', 'at the border of the city as well as country .', 'Vehicle detection and counting have various other application like traffic management , parking allotment , tracking the rescue vehicle in hill area , digital watermarking , vehicle tracking at the toll plaza and urban planning , etc .', 'However , vehicle detection and counting task are very challenging and difficult because of the complex background , the small size of the vehicle , other similar visual appearance object , distance , etc .', 'Till now , traditional methodology introduced several robust algorithms which has limitation while extracting the feature from aerial image .', 'Recently , deep learning-based algorithms introduced and the outcome of these algorithm are robust for such kind of application in the area of computer vision .', 'But accuracy of these algorithm is not optimized in aerial image because the deep learning algorithm required a huge amount of data to train the machine and the size of the object in aerial image is also too small .', 'All these factor affecting the efficiency of the real-time device .', 'This paper provides a brief description of traditional algorithms as well as machine learning and deep learning concept to identifying the object through aerial image .', 'The study has shown the comprehensive analysis of benchmark datasets and their parameter and corresponding challenge used by researcher and scientist in the area of object detection/tracking through aerial image .', 'Deep learning-based multi-feature semantic segmentation in building extraction from image of UAV photogrammetry .', 'Building information is an essential part of geographic information system ( GIS ) application in urban planning and management .', 'However , it changes rapidly with economic growth .', 'Unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) -based photogrammetry work well in this situation with its advantage of quick and high-resolution data updating .', 'In this paper , in order to improve building extraction accuracy in complex area where building are characterized by various pattern , complex structure , and unique style , we present a framework which applies deep learning ( DL ) semantic segmentation to UAV image with digital surface model ( DSM ) and visible-band difference vegetation index ( VDVI ) .', 'The result show that extraction accuracy improves .', 'The combination of red , green , blue ( RGB ) and VDVI band ( RGBVI ) can effectively distinguish the building area and vegetation .', 'The application of RGB with DSM band ( RGBD ) helps separate building from ground object .', 'The combination of RGB , DSM , and VDVI band ( RGBDVI ) can identify small building which are usually not high and covered partly by tree branch .', 'The proposed method is further applied to an open standard dataset to evaluate its robustness and result indicate an increased overall accuracy from RGB only ( 93 % ) to RGBD ( 97 % ) .', 'Scale-Robust Deep-Supervision Network for Mapping Building Footprint from High-Resolution Remote Sensing Images .', 'Building footprint information is one of the key factor for sustainable urban planning and environmental monitoring .', 'Mapping building footprint from remote sensing image is an important and challenging task in the earth observation field .', 'Over the year , convolutional neural network have shown outstanding improvement in the building extraction field due to their ability to automatically extract hierarchical feature and make building prediction .', 'However , as building are various in different size , scene , and roofing material , it is hard to precisely depict building of varied size , especially in large area ( e.g.', ', nationwide ) .', 'To tackle these limitation , we propose a novel deep-supervision convolutional neural network ( denoted as DS-Net ) for extracting building footprint from high-resolution remote sensing image .', 'In the proposed network , we applied deep supervision with an extra lightweight encoder , which enables the network to learn representative building feature of different scale .', 'Furthermore , a scale attention module is designed to aggregate multiscale feature and generate the final building prediction .', 'Experiment on two publicly available building datasets , including the WHU Building Dataset and the Massachusetts Building Dataset , show the effectiveness of the proposed method .', 'With only a 0.22-M increment of parameter compared with U-Net , the proposed DS-Net achieved an IoU of 90.4 % on the WHU Building Dataset and 73.8 % on the Massachusetts Dataset .', 'DS-Net also outperforms the state-of-the-art building extraction method on the two datasets , indicating the effectiveness of the proposed deep supervision and scale attention .', 'Using 3-D Convolution and Multimodal Architecture for Earthquake Damage Detection Based on Satellite Imagery and Digital Urban Data .', 'When a large earthquake occurs , it is quite important to quickly figure out the damage distribution of housing structure for disaster prevention measure .', 'Currently , the information is confirmed manually by local public organization , which takes a lot of time .', 'Therefore , a method is required for gathering the information more swiftly and objectively .', 'In this work , a novel method for detecting damage to single building from a set of multitemporal satellite image is developed by applying a recent machine learning approach .', 'The damage detection system is designed as a deep learning model that uses multimodal data , consisting of optical satellite image and structural attribute .', 'The proposed method achieved over 90 % detection accuracy on damaged housing in the affected area of 2016 Kumamoto earthquake , Japan from satellite image taken by Pleiades as well as digital urban data .', 'Satellite derived bathymetry using deep learning .', 'Coastal development and urban planning are facing different issue including natural disaster and extreme storm event .', 'The ability to track and forecast the evolution of the physical characteristic of coastal area over time is an important factor in coastal development , risk mitigation and overall coastal zone management .', 'Traditional bathymetry measurement are obtained using echo-sounding technique which are considered expensive and not always possible due to various complexity .', 'Remote sensing tool such as satellite imagery can be used to estimate bathymetry using incident wave signature and inversion model such as physical model of wave .', 'In this work , we present two novel approach to bathymetry estimation using deep learning and we compare the two proposed method in term of accuracy , computational cost , and applicability to real data .', 'We show that deep learning is capable of accurately estimating ocean depth in a variety of simulated case which offers a new approach for bathymetry estimation and a novel application for deep learning .', 'UVid-Net : Enhanced Semantic Segmentation of UAV Aerial Videos by Embedding Temporal Information .', 'Semantic segmentation of aerial videos has been extensively used for decision making in monitoring environmental change , urban planning , and disaster management .', 'The reliability of these decision support system is dependent on the accuracy of the video semantic segmentation algorithms .', 'The existing CNN-based video semantic segmentation method have enhanced the image semantic segmentation method by incorporating an additional module such as LSTM or optical flow for computing temporal dynamic of the video which is a computational overhead .', 'The proposed research work modifies the CNN architecture by incorporating temporal information to improve the efficiency of video semantic segmentation .', 'In this work , an enhanced encoder-decoder based CNN architecture ( UVid-Net ) is proposed for unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) video semantic segmentation .', 'The encoder of the proposed architecture embeds temporal information for temporally consistent labeling .', 'The decoder is enhanced by introducing the feature-refiner module , which aids in accurate localization of the class label .', 'The proposed UVid-Net architecture for UAV video semantic segmentation is quantitatively evaluated on extended ManipalUAVid dataset .', 'The performance metric mean Intersection over Union of 0.79 has been observed which is significantly greater than the other state-of-the-art algorithms .', 'Further , the proposed work produced promising result even for the pretrained model of UVid-Net on urban street scene by fine tuning the final layer on UAV aerial videos .', 'Attention-Gate-Based Encoder-Decoder Network for Automatical Building Extraction .', 'Rapidly developing remote sensing technology provides massive data for urban planning , mapping , and disaster management .', 'As a carrier of human productive activity , building are essential to both urban dynamic monitoring and suburban construction inspection .', 'Fully-convolutional-network-based method have provided a paradigm for automatically extracting building from high-resolution imagery .', 'However , high intraclass variance and complexity are two problem in building extraction .', 'It is hard to identify different scale of building by using a single receptive field .', 'For this purpose , in this article , we use the stable encoder- decoder architecture , combined with a grid-based attention gate and atrous spatial pyramid pooling module , to capture and restore feature progressively and effectively .', 'A modified ResNet50 encoder is also applied to extract feature .', 'The proposed method could learn gated feature and distinguish building from complex surroundings such as tree .', 'We evaluate our model on two building datasets , WHU aerial building dataset and our DB UAV rural building dataset .', 'Experiment show that our model outperforms other five most recent model .', 'The result also exhibit great potential for extracting building with different scale and validate the effectiveness of deep learning in practical scenario .', 'Precise object detection using adversarially augmented local/global feature fusion .', 'Object detection , which aims at recognizing or locating the object of interest in remote sensing imagery with high spatial resolution ( HSR ) , plays a significant role in many real-world scenario , e.g.', ', environment monitoring , urban planning , civil infrastructure construction , disaster rescuing , and geographic image retrieval .', 'As a long-lasting challenging problem in both machine learning and geoinformatics community , many approach have been proposed to tackle it .', 'However , previous method always overlook the abundant information embedded in the HSR remote sensing image .', 'The effectiveness of these method , e.g.', ', accuracy of detection , is therefore limited to some extent .', 'To overcome the mentioned challenge , in this paper , we propose a novel two-phase deep framework , dubbed GLGOD-Net , to effectively detect meaningful object in HSR image .', 'GLGOD-Net firstly attempts to learn the enhanced deep representation from super-resolution image data .', 'Fully utilizing the augmented image representation , GLGOD-Net then learns the fused representation into which both local and global latent feature are implanted .', 'Such fused representation learned by GLGOD-Net can be used to precisely detect different object in remote sensing image .', 'The proposed framework has been extensively tested on a real-world HSR image dataset for object detection and has been compared with several strong baseline .', 'The remarkable experimental result validate the effectiveness of GLGOD-Net .', 'The success of GLGOD-Net not only advances the cutting-edge of image data analytics , but also promotes the corresponding applicability of deep learning in remote sensing imagery .', 'A NOVEL SELF-TAUGHT LEARNING FRAMEWORK USING SPATIAL PYRAMID MATCHING for SCENE CLASSIFICATION .', 'Remote sensing earth observation image have a wide range of application in area like urban planning , agriculture , environment monitoring , etc .', 'While the industrial world benefit from availability of high resolution earth observation image since recent year , interpreting such image has become more challenging than ever .', 'Among many machine learning based method that have worked out successfully in remote sensing scene classification , spatial pyramid matching using sparse coding ( ScSPM ) is a classical model that has achieved promising classification accuracy on many benchmark data set .', 'ScSPM is a three-stage algorithm , composed of dictionary learning , sparse representation and classification .', 'It is generally believed that in the dictionary learning stage , although unsupervised , one should use the same data set as classification stage to get good result .', 'However , recent study in transfer learning suggest that it might be a better strategy to train the dictionary on a larger data set different from the one to classify .', 'In our work , we propose an algorithm that combines ScSPM with self-taught learning , a transfer learning framework that trains a dictionary on an unlabeled data set and uses it for multiple classification task .', 'In the experiment , we learn the dictionary on Caltech-101 data set , and classify two remote sensing scene image data set : UC Merced LandUse data set and Changping data set .', 'Experimental result show that the classification accuracy of proposed method is compatible to that of ScSPM .', 'Our work thus provides a new way to reduce resource cost in learning a remote sensing scene image classifier .', 'A generalized multi-task learning approach to stereo DSM filtering in urban area .', 'City model and height map of urban area serve as a valuable data source for numerous application , such as disaster management or city planning .', 'While this information is not globally available , it can be substituted by digital surface model ( DSMs ) , automatically produced from inexpensive satellite imagery .', 'However , stereo DSMs often suffer from noise and blur .', 'Furthermore , they are heavily distorted by vegetation , which is of lesser relevance for most application .', 'Such basic model can be filtered by convolutional neural network ( CNNs ) , trained on label derived from digital elevation model ( DEMs ) and 3D city model , in order to obtain a refined DSM .', 'We propose a modular multi-task learning concept that consolidates existing approach into a generalized framework .', 'Our encoder-decoder model with shared encoders and multiple task-specific decoder leverage roof type classification as a secondary task and multiple objective including a conditional adversarial term .', 'The contributing single-objective loss are automatically weighted in the final multi-task loss function based on learned uncertainty estimate .', 'We evaluated the performance of specific instance of this family of network architecture .', 'Our method consistently outperforms the state of the art on common data , both quantitatively and qualitatively , and generalizes well to a new dataset of an independent study area .', 'Object detection of aerial image using mask-region convolutional neural network ( mask R-CNN ) .', 'The most fundamental task in remote sensing data processing and analysis is object detection .', 'It plays an important role in classification and very useful for various application such as forestry , urban planning , agriculture , land use and land cover mapping , etc .', 'However , it has many challenge to find an appropriate method due to many variation in the appearance of the object in image .', 'The object may have occlusion , illumination , viewpoint variation , shadow , etc .', 'Many object detection method has been researched and developed .', 'Recently , the development of various machine learning-based method for object detection has been increasing .', 'Among of them are method based on artificial neural network , deep learning and its derivative .', 'In this research , object detection method of aerial image by using mask-region convolutional neural network ( mask-R CNN ) is developed .', 'The result shows that this method gives a significant accuracy by increasing the image training and epoch time .', 'Local climate zone mapping as remote sensing scene classification using deep learning : A case study of metropolitan China .', "China , with the world 's largest population , has gone through rapid development in the last forty year and now has over 800 million urban citizen .", 'Although urbanization lead to great social and economic progress , they may be confronted with other issue , including extra heat and air pollution .', 'Local climate zone ( LCZ ) , a new concept developed for urban heat island research , provides a standard classification system for the urban environment .', 'LCZs are defined by the context of the urban environment ; the minimum diameter of an LCZ is expected to be 400–1,000 m so that it can have a valid effect on the urban climate .', 'However , most existing method ( e.g.', ', the WUDAPT method ) regard this task as pixel-based classification , neglecting the spatial information .', 'In this study , we argue that LCZ mapping should be considered as a scene classification task to fully exploit the environmental context .', 'Fifteen city covering 138 million population in three economic region of China are selected as the study area .', 'Sentinel-2 multispectral data with a 10 m spatial resolution are used to classify LCZs .', 'A deep convolutional neural network composed of residual learning and the Squeeze-and-Excitation block , namely the LCZNet , is proposed .', 'We obtained an overall accuracy of 88.61 % by using a large image ( 48×48 corresponding to 480×480 m2 ) as the representation of an LCZ , 7.5 % higher than that using a small image representation ( 10×10 ) and nearly 20 % higher than that obtained by the standard WUDAPT method .', 'Image size from 32×32 to 64×64 were found suitable for LCZ mapping , while a deeper network achieved better classification with larger input .', 'Compared with natural class , urban class benefited more from a large input size , as it can exploit the environment context of urban area .', 'The combined use of the training data from all three region led to the best classification , but the transfer of LCZ model can not achieve satisfactory result due to the domain shift .', 'More advanced domain adaptation method should be applied in this application .', 'A locally-constrained YOLO framework for detecting small and densely-distributed building footprint .', 'Building footprint are among the most predominant feature in urban area , and provide valuable information for urban planning , solar energy suitability analysis , etc .', 'We aim to automatically and rapidly identify building footprint by leveraging deep learning technique and the increased availability of remote sensing datasets at high spatial resolution .', 'The task is computationally challenging due to the use of large training datasets and large number of parameter .', 'In related work , You-Only-Look-Once ( YOLO ) is a state-of-the-art deep learning framework for object detection .', 'However , YOLO is limited in its capacity to identify small object that appear in group , which is the case for building footprint .', 'We propose a LOcally-COnstrained ( LOCO ) You-Only-Look-Once framework to detect small and densely-distributed building footprint .', 'LOCO is a variant of YOLO .', 'Its layer architecture is determined by the spatial characteristic of building footprint and it uses a constrained regression modeling to improve the robustness of building size prediction .', 'We also present an invariant augmentation based voting scheme to further improve the precision in the prediction phase .', 'Experiment show that LOCO can greatly improve the solution quality of building detection compared to related work .', 'Urban Intelligent Navigator for Drone Using Convolutional Neural Network ( CNN ) .', 'It is still a difficult and challenging task for a drone to maneuver autonomously at low altitude in the urban environment .', 'This is due to the complexity of the urban environment and its unpredictability .', 'Many research have been carried out in the past decade until recent time , to find a way to solve this problem using powerful sensor such as laser rangefinder sensor , RGB-D camera , stereo vision system , LIDAR and computer vision method .', 'This paper is aimed to present an urban intelligent navigator for drone using CNN ( convolutional neural network ) .', 'The application of computer vision ( object detection ) is cheap and has low power consumption compared to other kind of vision system .', "The machine learning allows a drone to detect and recognize all the object and obstacle on the road , which can block drone 's way .", 'One thousand image were captured of six different street object ( tree , lamp , bump sign , free-smoking sign , no-horn sign , and roof-wall ) .', 'Those image were used as a dataset to create a machine learning using Faster R-CNN ( region convolutional neural network ) method .', 'Three machine-learning model were created using different parameter for each model .', 'The controlled parameter are the initial learning rate and the batch-size .', 'Only the third model could successfully detect and recognize all the object at a specified location showing 98 % accuracy .', 'THE POTENTIAL of BUILDING DETECTION from SAR and LIDAR USING DEEP LEARNING .', 'The introduction of airborne Synthetic Aperture Radar ( SAR ) approach has successfully addressed several challenge for mapping and surveying application Unlike other conventional sensor , airborne SAR mapping approach offers practicality and significant cost saving for the nation minimizing the need for ground control point on the ground in addition to providing high-resolution , day-and-night , cloud coverage and weather independent image , which in turn provides faster turnaround time for creation of large area geospatial data .', 'Up-to-date building map is necessary to guide the decision making in many field to understand the urban dynamic such as in disaster management , population estimation , planning and many other application .', 'Whilst mapping and surveying work using airborne SAR have started to capture many interest among surveyor , professional and practitioner abroad , Malaysia however is still lacking behind in term of the knowledge and the usage of this technology together with Deep Learning , Machine Learning approach especially in building extraction for topographic mapping and urban planning and development .', 'Deep learning is a subset of the machine learning algorithm .', 'Recently , Deep Learning has been proposed to solve traditional artificial intelligent problem .', 'In order to develop a sustainable national geospatial infrastructure for year to come , the integration between airborne SAR and other sensor as such LIDAR is therefore essential in Malaysia and in high demand for urban planning and management .', 'Thus , this paper reviews current technique and future trend of multi-sources Remote Sensing for building extraction .', 'Self-supervised feature learning for semantic segmentation of overhead imagery .', 'Overhead imagery play a crucial role in many application such as urban planning , crop yield forecasting , mapping , and policy making .', 'Semantic segmentation could enable automatic , efficient , and large-scale understanding of overhead imagery for these application .', 'However , semantic segmentation of overhead imagery is a challenging task , primarily due to the large domain gap from existing research in ground imagery , unavailability of large-scale dataset with pixel-level annotation , and inherent complexity in the task .', 'Readily available vast amount of unlabeled overhead imagery share more common structure and pattern compared to the ground imagery , therefore , its large-scale analysis could benefit from unsupervised feature learning technique .', 'In this work , we study various self-supervised feature learning technique for semantic
