machine-learning algorithms or for validation purpose .', 'In certain urban environment , however , of e.g.', ', highest density and structural complexity , textural and spectral complication in overlapping roof-structures still demand the human interpreter if one aims to capture individual building structure .', 'The cognitive perception and real-world experience are still inevitable .', 'Against these background , this article aims at quantifying and interpreting the uncertainty of mapping rooftop footprint of such area .', 'We focus on the agreement among interpreter and which aspect of perception and element of image interpretation affect mapping .', 'Ten test person digitized six complex built-up area .', 'Hereby , we receive quantitative information about spatial variable of building to systematically check the consistency and congruence of result .', 'An additional questionnaire reveals qualitative information about obstacle .', "Generally , we find large difference among interpreter ' mapping result and a high consistency of result for the same interpreter .", 'We measure rising deviation correlate with a rising morphologic complexity .', 'High degree of individuality are expressed e.g.', ', in time consumption , in-situ- or geographic information system ( GIS ) -precognition whereas data source mostly influences the mapping procedure .', 'By this study , we aim to fill a gap as prior research using MVII often does not implement an uncertainty analysis or quantify mapping aberration .', 'We conclude that remote sensing study should not only rely unquestioned on MVII for validation ; furthermore , data and method are needed to suspend uncertainty .', 'Deprivation pocket through the lens of convolutional neural network .', 'Machine learning technique have been frequently applied to map urban deprivation ( commonly referred to as slum ) in very high-resolution satellite image .', 'Among these , Deep Convolutional Neural Networks have shown exceptional efficiency in automated deprivation mapping at the local scale .', 'Yet these network have never been used to map very small heterogeneous deprivation area ( pocket ) at large scale .', 'This study proposes and evaluates a U-Net-Compound model to map deprivation pocket in Bangalore , India .', 'The model only relies on RGB satellite image with a resolution of 2 m as these are more commonly accessible to local urban planning department .', 'The experiment assumes a practical situation where only limited reference data is available for the model to learn the spatial morphology of deprivation pocket .', 'It tests whether an updated map of deprivation pocket can be obtained with limited information .', 'The model performance to map a large number of deprivation pocket is examined by incrementally changing the model architecture and the amount of training data .', 'Result show that the proposed model is sensitive to the amount of spatial information contained in the training data .', 'Once sufficient spatial information is learnt through a few sample , the city scale mapping accuracy outperforms existing model in mapping small deprivation pocket , achieving a Jaccard Index of 54 % .', 'This study demonstrated that a well-designed convolutional neural network can map the existence , extent , as well as distribution pattern of deprivation pocket at the city scale with limited training data , which is essential for upscaling research output to provide important information for the formulation of pro-poor policy .', 'Using Random Forest on paper , we propose an approach to address these challenge availed with machine learning technique .', 'The proposed system combine , fuse , and merges various type of data from different source , encodes them using a novel semantic model that can capture and utilize both low-level geometric information and higher level semantic information and subsequently feeds them to the random forests spatial score of the urban environment .', 'The finding provide useful insight for planning and urban policy .', 'Development of generating system for architectural color icon using google map use experiment , and consideration of five problem among architectural color icon creation .', 'It is assumed that the accuracy of the present system will be better as the technology improves .', 'Mapping long-term dynamic of population and dwelling based on a multi-temporal analysis of urban morphology .', 'Information on the distribution and dynamic of dwelling and their inhabitant is use information automatically extracted from historical topographic map .', 'For this purpose , method of image processing , machine learning , change detection and dasymetric mapping are applied .', 'The result for a study area in Germany show that it is possible to automatically derive decadal historical pattern of population and dwelling from 1950 to 2011 at the level of a 100 m grid with slight underestimation and acceptable standard deviation .', 'By a differentiated analysis we were able to quantify the error for different urban structure type .', "The syntactic signature of their location based on the asymmetry of accessibility created by the configuration of the street network .', 'In this article , I test the hypothesis whether configurational ( syntactic ) property of an urban street network are relevant for the location of land use .', "If syntactic feature are relevant , then land use type may have a 'syntactic signature ' .", 'To identify this blueprint , I apply machine-learning technique to datasets of syntactic measure , for ten business type .', 'The result are ten model , each with the syntactic blueprint of a type of business .', 'The model are used to predict the existence , or not , of such business in segment of the map of London .', "The performance of the model varies , with fifty per cent reaching statistical significance , including one with 'good ' prediction ability .", "The model for Starbucks coffee shop and solicitor 's office have the strongest prediction ability .", 'The exploratory exercise demonstrates the potential of .', 'Feature selection and knowledge extraction from buppu 2000 and 2010 census using artificial intelligence .', 'The census of population and dwelling undertaken by national state institution world '.', 'The approach is based on the BOSSA representation , which enriches the Bag of Words ( BoW ) model , in conjunction with the Spatial Pyramid Matching scheme and kernel-based machine learning ['Application of random forest and shap tree explainer in exploring spatial ( In ) justice to aid urban planning .', 'In light of recent local , national , and global event , spatial justice provides a potentially powerful lens by which to explore a multitude of spatial inequality .', 'For more than two decade , scholar have been espousing the power of this concept to help develop more equitable and just community .', 'However , defining spatial justice and developing a methodology for quantitatively an-alyzing it is complicated and no agreed upon metric for examining spatial justice has been developed .', 'Instead , individual measure of spatial injustice have been studied .', 'One such individual measure is economic mobility .', 'Recent research on economic mobility has revealed the importance of local geography on upward mobility and may serve as an important keystone in developing a metric for multiple place-based issue of spatial inequality .', 'This paper seeks to explore place-based variable within individual census tract in an effort to understand their impact on economic mobility and potentially spatial justice .', 'The methodology relies on machine learning technique and the result show that the best performing model is able to predict economic mobility of a census tract based on its spatial variable with 86 % accuracy .', 'The availability and density of job , compactness of the area , and the presence of medical facility and underground storage tank have the greatest influence , whereas some of the influential feature are positively while the others are negatively associated .', 'In the end , this research will allow for comparative analysis between differing geography and also identify leading variable in the overall quest for spatial justice .', 'Sustainable development scale of housing estate : An economic assessment using machine learning approach .', 'Economic sustainability is often addressed from the perspective of economic growth and at the national level .', 'In contrast , this research attempts to examine the question of economic sustainability of human settlement at a local project level .', 'Urban planner need to strike a balance between dispersal and over-concentration of population in city .', 'The existing theory suggest that either excessively low or extremely high level of household concentration is undesirable to a neighborhood .', 'In this study , an economic assessment using machine learning ( ML ) technique is used to identify the threshold scale of a housing estate , which comprises many privately owned residential unit ( like condos ) with shared amenity .', 'Using two decade of property transaction data in Hong Kong as our evidence , this study has found that a tipping point exists in the development scale of these housing estate .', 'Housing value initially rise with the number of residential unit in a housing estate but gradually fall when it increases beyond a critical limit .', 'This nonlinear economic relationship is attributed to the per household share of common facility , which does not increase sufficiently to match with the growing population density of the housing estate .', 'The policy implication is that , to optimize housing supply , urban planning should not just focus on increasing the development bulk of housing but should also pay attention to the possible bottleneck in the provision of shared amenity in the neighborhood .', 'Safe city in the new urban world : A comparative cluster dynamic analysis through machine learning .', 'City in the ‘ New Urban World ’ display an enormous diversity in appearance , growth and performance .', 'The awareness is growing that the urban development potential ( ‘ magnetism ’ ) of city is closely related to safety and security condition in these city .', 'This paper develops a new analytical framework based on a wealth of empirical data on both safety/security and socio-economic magnetism achievement of many world city , by combining two comprehensive relevant global urban data base .', 'The aim of the study is to offer a comparative analysis of the combined safety/security data and socio-economic performance data of 30 global city , through the use of an advanced sequential cluster dynamic analysis that is ( partly ) inspired by a novel machine learning approach ( using Python software ) .', 'In this way , city can be categorized according to their quantitative characteristic feature represented by the relevant cluster .', 'It appears that city safety/security feature are an important predictor of the variability in overall urban performance regarding magnetism .', 'This study allows also for drawing relevant policy lesson .', 'Delineation of an Urban Community Life Circle Based on a Machine-Learning Estimation of Spatiotemporal Behavioral Demand .', 'Delineating life circle is an essential prerequisite for urban community life circle planning .', 'Recent study combined the environmental contexts with resident ’ global positioning system ( GPS ) data to delineate the life circle .', 'This method , however , is constrained by GPS data , and it can only be applied in the GPS surveyed community .', 'To address this limitation , this study developed a generalizable delineation method without the constraint of behavioral data .', 'According to previous research , the community life circle consists of the walking-accessible range and internal structure .', 'The core task to develop the generalizable method was to estimate the spatiotemporal behavioral demand for each plot of land to acquire the internal structure of the life circle , as the range can be delineated primarily based on environmental data .', 'Therefore , behavioral demand estimation model were established through logistic regression and machine learning technique , including decision tree and ensemble learning .', 'The model with the lowest error rate was chosen as the final estimation model for each type of land .', 'Finally , we used a community without GPS data as an example to demonstrate the effectiveness of the estimation model and delineation method .', 'This article extends the existing literature by introducing spatiotemporal behavioral demand estimation model , which learn the relationship between environmental contexts , population composition and the existing delineated result based on GPS data to delineate the internal structure of the community life circle without employing behavioral data .', 'Furthermore , the proposed method and delineation result also contributes to facility adjustment and location selection in life circle planning , people-oriented transformation in urban planning , and activity space estimation of the population in evaluating and improving the urban policy .', 'A glimpse into the future of exposure and vulnerability in city ?', 'Modelling of residential location choice of urban population with random forest .', 'The most common approach to assessing natural hazard risk is investigating the willingness to pay in the presence or absence of such risk .', 'In this work , we propose a new , machine-learning-based , indirect approach to the problem , i.e .', 'through residential-choice modelling .', 'Especially in urban environment , exposure and vulnerability are highly dynamic risk component , both being shaped by a complex and continuous reorganization and redistribution of asset within the urban space , including the ( re- ) location of urban dweller .', 'By modelling residential-choice behaviour in the city of Leipzig , Germany , we seek to examine how exposure and vulnerability are shaped by the residential-location-choice process .', 'The proposed approach reveals hot spot and cold spot of residential choice for distinct socioeconomic group exhibiting heterogeneous preference .', 'We discuss the relationship between observed pattern and disaster risk through the lens of exposure and vulnerability , as well as link to urban planning , and explore how the proposed methodology may contribute to predicting future trend in exposure , vulnerability , and risk through this analytical focus .', 'Avenue for future research include the operational strengthening of these linkage for more effective disaster risk management .', 'An urban data framework for assessing equity in city : Comparing accessibility to healthcare facility in Cascadia .', 'As city continue to grow worldwide , policymakers and urban planner face the dual task of meeting rising demand for essential service while ensuring that benefit accrue to their citizen equitably .', 'We propose a framework for assessing inclusivity and equity in city , which leverages open data and machine learning technique to inform urban infrastructure investment strategy .', 'The framework is applied at a regional scale to compare differential access to healthcare facility ( public hospital and clinic ) via public transit in Vancouver , Seattle and Portland .', 'We find important distributional impact on vulnerable population across the three city .', "Portland displays the highest inequity in hospital and clinic access , and Vancouver the least , owing to Vancouver 's relatively compact geographic area and high population density .", 'For senior , over 75 % are socially excluded from hospital and over 50 % from clinic in Portland , compared to 30 % and 3 % respectively in Vancouver .', 'In all three city , significantly more resident of low-income neighborhood are excluded from healthcare compared to their counterpart in high-income neighborhood .', 'This translates into proportionally higher transportation cost for low-income area resident compared with high-income area resident , regardless of whether they are socially excluded or not .', 'Transportation cost are notably high for low-income senior in Seattle and Vancouver .', 'These finding pose a challenge for inclusive planning , since low-income and senior population may require specialized service and are more reliant on public transportation than the average population .', "Our evaluation framework provides a systematic approach for municipality to account for the distributional effect of transportation and service infrastructure planning , to integrate equity into their decision-making , and to learn from the success and pitfall of each other 's urban policy .", 'Impact of community deprivation on urban park access over time : Understanding the relative role of contributor for urban planning .', 'As an important element of urban landscape , park plays an important role in building environmentally sustainable city .', 'Thus , it is important to examine park accessibility and how it changes over time in relation to community deprivation so as to provide all resident with equitable service .', 'Using the Gaussian-based 2SFCA ( two-step floating catchment area ) method , this paper analyzes dynamic park accessibility from 2016 to 2018 for community within the Hangzhou metropolitan area in China and then quantifies the relative role of local contributor to park accessibility change ( population , park and transport network ) .', 'A machine learning algorithm , which handles the interdependence of deprivation dimension , is further employed to determine the relationship between community deprivation and park accessibility change .', 'Result show that park accessibility continued to grow during the study period , and most community achieved excellent park accessibility by 2018 .', 'Population decrease and park increase contribute positively to improved park accessibility , while transport network change have had less of an impact .', 'Deprived community have observed a rising trend of park accessibility , while the elderly concentrated community are more likely to experience declined park accessibility .', 'Our study provides a new methodological framework , which integrates the geographical accessibility model , economic chain substitution model and machine learning algorithm , for understanding the dynamic park access and associated social inequality in rapidly urbanizing region .', 'The lesson learned from this study should be insightful for urban planning .', 'Investigating Customer Satisfaction Patterns in a Community Livability Context : An Efficiency-Oriented Decision-Making Approach .', 'A comprehensive understanding of neighborhood facility distribution and function along with residential quality of life satisfaction is a key asset for relating livability management to transportation network .', "Due to the simultaneous involvement of varied factor with an individual 's perception of livability , this concept is difficult to measure .", 'Therefore , a more objective mean of quantifying livability is needed .', "The service industry has demonstrated the intersection of machine learning classifier and survey domain knowledge for evaluating user ' quality of experience ; however , this process of inquiry-based learning has never been considered for solving the communication difficulty between community stakeholder and transportation agency .", 'Another area of overlap is that of urban computing , which integrates computing technology in the traditional context of urban area , connecting ubiquitous sensing technology , computational power , and data about the urban environment to promote quality of life for people living in a particular community .', 'To this aim , the focus of this study is on interpreting a linkage between society stated preference and quantitative measure of livability by extracting information from survey-based method and translating it to a quantitative framework using combined service industry and urban computing methodology .', 'This work focuses on four transportation planning-related research question in this blended framework : understanding existing livability pattern , predicting heterogeneous perception of quality of life , prioritizing public preference , and developing a multidimensional livability index ( MLI ) .', 'Localization Decisions of Entrepreneurs : The Role of Path Dependency and Market Forces .', 'The purpose of this research is to determine the role of path dependency and market force in the localization decision of entrepreneur from different industry .', 'We hypothesize that most industry develop new entity based on the number of company from the same industry that already exist in a region .', 'We also hypothesize that entrepreneur create new entity based on related industry operating within the same knowledge pool .', 'To test these hypothesis , we used the machine learning decision tree method .', 'The input variable are the number of company from 86 industry located in 2,531 community in Poland in 2009 .', 'The target value are the number of new company from these industry created in the year 2009-2015 .', 'The principal result show that localization decision are mostly based on demand and supply industry , in which manufacturing industry play crucial role .', "Path dependency appears in less than half of the industry ' model and thus is not the main factor influencing decision regarding the creation of new company .", 'The highest share of path-dependent industry is in manufacturing sector , but the degree of the dependence is lower than in the service sector .', 'The service sector seems to be the least path-dependent , as service usually serve other industry .', 'Competition in industry is a rare factor in new company creation ; however , if it appears , it usually shrinks the industry .', 'Structure and information in spatial segregation .', 'Ethnoracial residential segregation is a complex , multiscalar phenomenon with immense moral and economic cost .', 'Modeling the structure and dynamic of segregation is a pressing problem for sociology and urban planning , but existing method have limitation .', 'In this paper , we develop a suite of method , grounded in information theory , for studying the spatial structure of segregation .', 'We first advance existing profile and decomposition method by posing two related regionalization method , which allow for profile curve with nonconstant spatial scale and decomposition analysis with nonarbitrary areal unit .', 'We then formulate a measure of local spatial scale , which may be used for both detailed , within-city analysis and intercity comparison .', 'These method highlight detailed insight in the structure and dynamic of urban segregation that would be otherwise easy to miss or difficult to quantify .', 'They are computationally efficient , applicable to a broad range of study question , and freely available in open source software .']

['Local and application-specific geodemographics for data-led urban decision making .', 'This work seeks to introduce improvement to the traditional variable selection procedure employed in the development of geodemographic classification .', 'It presents a proposal for shifting from a traditional approach for generating general-purpose one-size-fits-all geodemographic classification to application-specific classification .', 'This proposal addresses the recent scepticism towards the utility of general-purpose application by employing supervised machine learning technique in order to identify contextually relevant input variable from which to develop geodemographic classification with increased discriminatory power .', 'A framework introducing such technique in the variable selection phase of geodemographic classification development is presented via a practical use-case that is focused on generating a geodemographic classification with an increased capacity for discriminating the propensity for Library use in the UK city of Leeds .', 'Two local classification are generated for the city , one a general-purpose classification , and the other , an application-specific classification incorporating supervised Feature Selection method in the selection of input variable .', 'The discriminatory power of each classification is evaluated and compared , with the result successfully demonstrating the capacity for the application-specific approach to generate a more contextually relevant result , and thus underpins increasingly targeted public policy decision making , particularly in the context of urban planning .', 'Classification of Urban Functional Areas from Remote Sensing Images and Time-Series User Behavior Data .', 'Urbanization is accelerating at a rapid rate , which has introduced many challenge , especially in the field of urban planning .', 'Under the backdrop of global urbanization , some city are particularly vulnerable to climate change and natural disaster that are influenced by unplanned urban expansion .', 'Rational planning of urban functional area needs to be strengthened to improve the scientific approach of urban planning and urbanization .', 'In this study , the classification of urban functional area based on dual-modal data ( i.e.', ', remote sensing image and user behavior data ) was implemented using machine learning ( ML ) algorithms .', 'After the set test , the classification accuracy of urban functional area reached 82.45 % .', 'Through analysis , it could be concluded that the use of data of two modality achieved a higher classification accuracy than that achieved by using data of a single modality .', 'The data of the two modality complement each other , and the use of ML algorithms to train such data can yield good result .', 'Machine learning for comparative urban planning at scale : An aviation case study .', 'Aviation is in flux , experiencing 5.4 % yearly growth over the last two decade .', 'However , with COVID-19 aviation was hard hit .', 'This , along with its contribution to global warming , has led to louder call to limit its use .', 'This situation emphasizes how urban planner and technologist could contribute to understanding and responding to this change .', 'This paper explores a novel workflow of performing image-based machine learning ( ML ) on satellite image of over 1.000 world airport that were algonthmically collated using European Space Agency Sentinel2 API .', 'From these , the top 350 United States airport were analyzed with land use parameter extracted around the airport using computer vision , which were mapped against their passenger footfall number .', 'The result demonstrate a scalable approach to identify how easy and beneficial it would be for certain airport to expand or contract and how this would impact the surrounding urban environment in term of pollution and congestion .', 'The generic nature of this workflow makes it possible to potentially extend this method to any large infrastructure and compare and analyze specific feature across a large number of image while being able to understand the same feature through time .', 'This is critical in answering key typology-based urban design challenge at a higher level and without needing to perform on-ground study , which could be expensive and time-consuming .', 'A machine learning-based classification system for urban built-up area using multiple classifier and data source .', 'Information about urban built-up area is important for urban planning and management .', 'However , obtaining accurate information about urban built-up area is a challenge .', 'This study developed a general-purpose built-up area intelligent classification ( BAIC ) system that supports various type of data and classifier .', 'All of the step in the BAIC were implemented using Python module including Numpy , Pandas , matplotlib , and scikit-learn .', 'We used the BAIC to conduct a classification experiment that involved seven type of input data ; namely , Point of Interest ( POI ) , Road Network ( RN ) , nighttime light ( NTL ) , a combination of POI and RN data ( POI_RN ) , a combination of POI and NTL data ( POI_NTL ) , a combination of RN and NTL data ( RN_NTL ) , and a combination of POI , RN , and NTL data ( POI_RN_NTL ) , and five classifier , namely , Logistic Regression ( LR ) , Decision Tree ( DT ) , Random Forests ( RF ) , Gradient Boosted Decision Trees ( GBDT ) , and AdaBoost .', 'The result show the following : ( 1 ) among the 35 combination of the five classifier and seven type of input data , the overall accuracy ( OA ) ranged from 76 to 89 % , F1 value ranged from 0.73 to 0.86 , and the area under the receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curve ( AUC ) ranged from 0.83 to 0.95 .', 'The largest F1 value and OA were obtained using the POI_RN_NTL data and AdaBoost , while the largest AUC was obtained using POI_RN_NTL and POI_NTL data against AdaBoost , LR , and RF ; and ( 2 ) the advantage of the BAIC include its support for multi-source input data , its objective accuracy assessment , and its robust classifier .', 'The BAIC can quickly and efficiently realize the automatic classification of urban built-up area at a reasonably low cost and can be readily applied to other urban area in the world where any kind of POI , RN , or NTL data coverage is available .', 'The result of this study are expected to provide timely and effective reference information for urban planning and urban management department , and could also potentially be used to develop large-scale map of urban built-up area in the future .', 'Urban street context classification using convolutional neural network and street imagery .', 'The classification of street on road network has been focused on the vehicular transportational feature of street .', 'Example of street label include arterials , major road , minor road and so forth based on their transportational use .', 'City authority on the other hand have been shifting to more wholistic planning of street .', 'The modern approach towards designing and planning street is more inclusive of the street context , meaning the side use of a street combined with the transportational feature of a street .', 'Several city authority are developing new classification scheme for street context that extends traditional classification method to include the use of land on the side of a street .', 'In those classification scheme , street are labeled for example as commercial throughway , residential neighborhood , park etc .', 'This modern approach to urban planning have been adopted by major city such as the city of San Francisco , the state of Florida and Pennsylvania among many others .', 'Currently , the process of labeling street according to their contexts is manual and hence is tedious and time consuming .', 'It will require manual labor to regularly relabel street as the city develops .', 'In this paper , we propose an approach to deploy advancement in computer vision towards modern urban planning .', 'We propose a framework for automatic classification of street context .', 'Using labeled street imagery we train deep convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to perform the classification of street context .', 'We show that CNN model can perform well achieving accuracy in the 81 % to 87 % range .', 'We test various CNN architecture and report on their performance .', 'Comparison of approach for urban functional zone classification based on multi-source geospatial data : A case study in Yuzhong District , Chongqing , China .', 'Accurate and timely classification and monitoring of urban functional zone prove to be significant in rapidly developing city , to better understand the real and varying urban function of city to support urban planning and management .', 'Many effort have been undertaken to identify urban functional zone using various classification approach and multi-source geospatial datasets .', 'The complexity of this category of classification pose tremendous challenge to these study especially in term of classification accuracy , but on the opposite , the rapid development of machine learning technology provides us with new opportunity .', 'In this study , a set of commonly used urban functional zone classification approach , including Multinomial Logistic Regression , K-Nearest Neighbors , Decision Tree , Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) , and Random Forest , are examined and compared with the newly developed eXtreme Gradient Boosting ( XGBoost ) model , using the case study of Yuzhong District , Chongqing , China .', 'The investigation is based on multi-variate geospatial data , including night-time imagery , geotagged Weibo data , point of interest ( POI ) from Gaode , and Baidu Heat Map .', 'This study is the first endeavor of implementing the XGBoost model in the field of urban functional zone classification .', 'The result suggest that the XGBoost classification model performed the best and was able to achieve an accuracy of 88.05 % , which is significantly higher than the other commonly used approach .', 'In addition , the integration of night-time imagery , geotagged Weibo data , POI from Gaode , and Baidu Heat Map has also demonstrated their value for the classification of urban functional zone in this case study .', 'Exploring different combination of data and method for urban land use analysis : A survey .', 'Modern planning and management of urban space is an essential topic for smart city and depends on up-to-date and reliable information on land use and functional role of the place that integrate urban area .', 'In the last year , driven by increased availability of geo-referenced data from social or embedded sensor and remote sensing ( RS ) image , various method become popular for land use analysis .', 'This paper addresses the various method employed in this context , as well as needed data and respective categorization , best application of each method , and their comparison .', 'We focus on approach based on data from RS image , open map and various category of crowdsourced data .', 'We identify and discuss the way these approach use Data Mining ( DM ) and Machine Learning ( ML ) .', 'From our initial study we concluded that even using the same method and the same kind of data , result depend on spatial configuration of the data , accordingly to the specificity of each region .', 'The work described in this paper is intended to provide relevant contribution to method selection for knowledge discovery for city planning and management , taking into consideration available data and the pro and con of each technique .', 'Deep CNN-based method to evaluate neighborhood-scale urban valuation through street scene perception .', 'Social data from city level provides unprecedented opportunity to identify urban attribute from various angle .', 'Citizen are likely to evaluate the quality of the neighborhood and make important decision by their perception and the feedback from the environment .', "In this paper , we studied the correlation between the neighborhood 's environment with their property value and land value .", 'It is profitable to train the algorithm by parallel deep convolutional neural network on the visual urban scene data associated with quantitative non-visual urban characteristic in the same view .', 'The result of our approach defines a scenarized profile from building-level detail to city-level trait .', 'The main contribution of this work is providing a unique and more accurate perspective to urban valuation estimation , by integrating the scattered source of piece of information and implanting into the available image .', 'This urban evaluation approach will be more human-centered , which can be extended to help urban planner and citizen to explore the significant impact on city decision optimization or spatial economics-related issue like decreasing the cost of property assessment .', 'Using image recognition to automate assessment of cultural ecosystem service from social medium photographs .', 'Quantifying and mapping cultural ecosystem service is complex because of their intangibility .', 'Data from social medium , such as geo-tagged photographs , have been proposed for mapping cultural use or appreciation of ecosystem .', 'However , manual content analysis and classification of large number of photographs is time consuming .', 'This study develops a novel method for automating content analysis of social medium photographs for ecosystem service assessment .', 'The approach applies an online machine learning algorithm – Google Cloud Vision – to analyse over 20,000 photograph from Singapore , and uses hierarchical clustering to group these photograph .', 'The accuracy of the classification was assessed by comparison with manual classification .', 'Over 20 % of photographs were taken of nature , being of animal or plant .', 'The distribution of nature photographs was concentrated around particular natural attraction , and nature photographs were more likely to occur in park and area of high vegetation cover .', 'The approach developed for clustering photographs was accurate and saved approximately 170 h of manual work .', 'The method provides an indicator of cultural ecosystem service that can be applied rapidly over large area .', 'Automated assessment and mapping of cultural ecosystem service could be used to inform urban planning .', 'Can we predict the scenic beauty of location from geo-tagged Flickr image ?', '.', 'In this work , we propose a novel technique to determine the aesthetic score of a location from social metadata of Flickr photo .', 'In particular , we built machine learning classifier to predict the class of a location where each class corresponds to a set of location having equal aesthetic rating .', 'These model are trained on two empirically build datasets containing location in two different city ( Rome and Paris ) where aesthetic rating of location were gathered from TripAdvisor.com .', 'In this work we exploit the idea that in a location with higher aesthetic rating , it is more likely for an user to capture a photo and other user are more likely to interact with that photo .', 'Our model achieved as high as 79.48 % accuracy ( 78.60 % precision and 79.27 % recall ) on Rome dataset and 73.78 % accuracy ( 75.62 % precision and 78.07 % recall ) on Paris dataset .', 'The proposed technique can facilitate urban planning , tour planning and recommending aesthetically pleasing path .', 'Building block level urban land-use information retrieval based on Google Street View image .', 'Land-use map are important reference for urban planning and urban study .', 'Given the heterogeneity of urban land-use type , it is difficult to differentiate different land-use type based on overhead remotely sensed data .', 'Google Street View ( GSV ) image , which capture the façades of building block along street , could be better used to judge the land-use type of different building block based on their façade appearance .', 'Recently developed scene classification algorithms in computer vision community make it possible to categorize different photo semantically based on various image feature descriptor and machine-learning algorithms .', 'Therefore , in this study , we proposed a method to derive detailed land-use information at building block level based on scene classification algorithms and GSV image .', 'Three image feature descriptor ( i.e.', ', scale-invariant feature transform-Fisher , histogram of oriented gradient , GIST ) were used to represent GSV image of different building .', 'Existing land-use map were used to create training datasets to train support vector machine ( SVM ) classifier for categorizing GSV image .', 'The trained SVM classifier were then applied to case study area in New York City , Boston , and Houston , to predict the land-use information at building block level .', 'Accuracy assessment result show that the proposed method is suitable for differentiating residential building and nonresidential building with an accuracy of 85 % or so .', 'Since the GSV image are publicly accessible , this proposed method would provide a new way for building block level land-use mapping in future .', 'Mapping urban form and function at city block level using spatial metric .', 'This paper focuses on the potential of urban metric describing the presence and the configuration of built-up and open space area for mapping distinct type of urban form and function at city block level .', "Next to traditional , patch-based metric used in landscape ecology , alternative metric are proposed , measuring the presence and the spatial arrangement of built-up and open space area along a set of radial transects , along contour parallel to the urban block boundary and along the block 's perimeter , as well as metric describing the internal composition of the built-up area .", 'Use of the proposed metric for identifying different type of urban form and function was tested on the Brussels Capital Region .', 'Large-scale vector data was used to define built-up structure and to analyse the morphological property of the built-up area at block level .', 'Decision tree classification was applied in conjunction with bootstrap aggregation to gain insight in the distinctive character of the defined metric , and the robustness of land use and urban form classification based on these metric .', 'Our study point out the shortcoming of traditional landscape ecological metric for mapping urban form and emphasizes the need for alternative approach for analysing urban landscape , more explicitly describing the morphological characteristic of the urban fabric .', 'Urban land use information retrieval based on scene classification of Google Street View image .', 'Land use map are very important reference for the urban planning and management .', 'However , it is difficult and time-consuming to get high-resolution urban land use map .', 'In this study , we propose a new method to derive land use information at building block level based on machine learning and geo-tagged street-level imagery - Google Street View image .', 'Several commonly used generic image feature ( GIST , HoG , and SIFT-Fisher ) are used to represent street-level image of different cityscape in a case study area of New York City .', 'Machine learning is further used to categorize different image based on the calculated image feature of different street-level image .', 'Accuracy assessment result show that the method developed in this study is a promising method for land use mapping at building block level in future .', 'Building type classification using spatial and landscape attribute derived from LiDAR remote sensing data .', 'Building information is one of the key element for a range of urban planning and management practice .', 'In this study , an investigation was performed to classify building delineated from light detection and ranging ( LiDAR ) remote sensing data into three type : single-family house , multiple-family house , and non-residential building .', 'Four kind of spatial attribute describing the shape , location , and surrounding environment of building were calculated and subsequently employed in the classification .', 'Experiment were performed in suburban and downtown site in Denver , CO , USA , considering different building component and neighborhood environment .', 'Building type classification result yielded overall accuracy > 70 % and Kappa > 0.5 for both site , demonstrating the feasibility of obtaining building type information from LiDAR data .', 'The shape attributes , such as width , footprint area , and perimeter , were most useful for identifying building type .', 'Environmental landscape attributes surrounding building , such as the number of road and parking lot pixel , also contributed to obtaining building type information .', 'Combining shape and environmental landscape attribute was necessary to obtain accurate and consistent classification result .', 'Classification of sidewalk in street view image .', 'Mapping sidewalk in urban environment is key in the creation of pedestrian-friendly , sustainable city .', 'Currently , urban planner are hindered by a lack of information available in a format suitable for the large-scale analysis of sidewalk design .', 'To demonstrate the impact that information technology could have in this area , we leverage technique from machine learning and computer vision to gather information about the presence and quality of sidewalk in map image .', 'In particular , we identify sidewalk segment in street view image using a random forest classifier , utilizing a set of local and global feature that include geometric context , presence of lane , pixel color , and location .', 'Our result illustrate that this approach is effective in classifying sidewalk segment in a large set of street view image .', 'This algorithm can be easily extended to other datasets , and can be automated to gather complete , fine-grained detail about sidewalk for arbitrarily large urban environment .', 'Visual gaze analysis of robotic pedestrian moving in urban space .', 'This study is founded on the idea that an analysis of the visual gaze dynamic of pedestrian can increase our understanding of how important architectural feature in urban environment are perceived by pedestrian .', 'The result of such an analysis can lead to improvement in urban design .', 'However , a technical challenge arises when trying to determine the gaze direction of pedestrian recorded on video .', 'High noise level and the subtlety of human gaze dynamic hamper precise calculation .', 'However , as robot can be programmed and analysed more efficiently than human , this study uses them for developing and training a gaze analysis system with the aim to later apply it to human video data using the machine learning technique of manifold alignment .', 'For this study , a laboratory was set up to become a model street scene in which autonomous humanoid robot of approximately 55cm in height simulate the behaviour of human pedestrian .', 'The experiment compare the input from several camera as the robot walks down the model street and changes its behaviour upon encountering visually attractive object .', "Overhead recording and the robot 's internal joint signal are analysed after filtering to provide true data against which the recorded data can be compared for accuracy testing .", 'A central component of the research is the calculation of a torus-like manifold that represents all the different three-dimensional ( 3D ) head direction of a robot head and allows the ordering of extracted 3D gaze vector obtained from video sequence .', 'We briefly describe how the obtained multidimensional trajectory data can be analysed by using a temporal behaviour analysis technique based on support vector machine that was developed separately .']

['Reconceptualizing urban heat island : Beyond the urban-rural dichotomy .', 'Past decade have seen drastically increasing research effort and progress on the study of the phenomenon of urban heat island ( UHI ) .', 'Despite its simplicity , this convenient concept has promoted significant advance in scientific research and policy making processes in the urban environmental community .', 'Nevertheless , the oversimplification and inadequacy of the urban-rural dichotomy , inherited in the UHI concept , is increasingly manifest today in the continuously urbanized world .', 'In this study , we conduct a holistic and in-depth survey of the inadequacy of the urban-rural dichotomy intrinsic to the definition of UHI , from theoretical , technical , and practical perspective .', 'In addition , in the light of recent research advance , we urge to radically reconceptualize UHI by proposing a novel paradigm by treating the total urban environment as a complex dynamic system .', 'The new framework broadens the frontier of conventional urban environmental study by utilizing advanced technique of complex system and data science , including complex network theory , machine learning technique , causal inference , etc .', 'The reconceptualization of UHI is also expected to foster decision making and urban planning , and to avoid the one-sidedness of the singular and often too exclusive aim of heat mitigation .', 'DTEx : A dynamic urban thermal exposure index based on human mobility pattern .', 'Background : Extreme heat in light of climate change is increasingly threatening the health and comfort of urban resident .', 'Understanding spatio-temporal pattern of heat exposure is a critical factor in directing mitigation measure .', 'Current heat vulnerability index provide insight into heat sensitivity within given community but do not account for the dynamic nature of the human movement as people travel for different activity .', 'Here , we present a new Dynamic urban Thermal Exposure index ( DTEx ) that captures the varying heat exposure within urban environment .', 'Method : We developed the DTEx to understand human heat exposure patterns in a mid-sized city .', 'This index incorporates the human movement pattern and the heat hazard pattern obtained via novel and advanced technique .', 'We generated the human movement pattern from large-scale , anonymized smartphone location data .', 'The heat hazard pattern were extrapolated via machine learning model from air temperature data measured through vehicle-mounted sensor .', 'The exposure index was then developed by combining the two parameter using their standard-deviation-classified index .', 'Result : Our exposure index varied between 2 and 12 , indicating low to high thermal exposure .', 'Several high-temperature spot associated with a large volume of foot traffic are successfully identified through this DTEx .', 'We observed the hottest spot at shopping plazas but not specifically in the urban center .', 'During the selected football gameday , the exposure index surged across most place near the football stadium but was reduced considerably further away .', 'Discussion : The proposed DTEx is novel because it provides dynamic heat monitoring capability to facilitate heat mitigation strategy at vulnerable location in urban environment .', 'Combining the mobility data and extensive sensor data generates rich detail on the most heat-exposed area due to human congregation .', 'Such information will be critical for risk communication and urban planning for policymakers .', 'DTEx could also help smart route planning in sustainable city to avoid heat hazard risk .', 'Towards low carbon city : A machine learning method for predicting urban block carbon emission ( UBCE ) based on built environment factor ( BEF ) in Changxing City , China .', 'Predicting urban block carbon emission ( UBCE ) accurately based on built environment factor ( BEF ) is an effective way to reduce UBCE and alleviate urban heat island ( UHI ) from the perspective of urban planning .', 'At an urban level , this study collected various source of data and proposed a machine learning method ( Back Propagation Neural Network - BPNN ) to predict different function of UBCE by BEF in Changxing , a representative small city in China .', 'The study found that UBCE can be significantly affected by BEF such as density , function , and morphology .', 'The BPNN has a good prediction performance on different function of UBCE , and the mean absolute percentage error ( MAPE ) is stable within 10 % –20 % .', 'The prediction result showed that the average value of different function of UBCE presented an obvious variation .', 'The carbon emission map showed that the high UBCE are mainly clustered in the middle-east and south of the central city of Changxing .', 'By comparison with other study , the accuracy of this method was proved .', 'This method could be applied to predict carbon emission of the urban planning scheme .', 'Optimizing the BEF of urban block can play key role in the reduction of carbon emission and then alleviation of the UHI .', 'Estimating the influence of building and urban form on the thermal load of urban dwelling in the Mediterranean climate using machine learning .', 'The paper presents a novel method of generating metamodels that can quantify the influence of urban form on the heating and cooling load of dwelling for the Mediterranean climate .', 'The goal of the metamodels is to inform the early urban design process with quick and accurate feedback on the energy demand of a given urban configuration .', 'The proposed method generates training datasets through Monte Carlo dynamic energy simulation of a single thermal zone .', 'The study focuses on the geometrical parameter that affect building energy balance at the urban scale , such as dwelling shape , compactness , adjacency and shading , utilizing a set of morphological indicator to relate these parameter to heating and cooling load .', 'The study focuses on the Mediterranean climate of Thessaloniki , Greece and utilizes several open-source tool ( Ladybug Tools , EnergyPlus and Scikit-learn ) under a streamlined workflow .', 'The metamodels , which are trained using the Random Forest algorithm are then validated on 12 real-world urban site of Thessaloniki with a reported Mean Average Percentage Error ( MAPE ) of 12 % and 15 % for heating and cooling load , respectively .', 'Thermal comfort prediction by applying supervised machine learning in green sidewalk of Tehran .', 'Purpose : This research aims to introduce a new methodology for integration between urban design strategy and supervised machine learning ( SML ) method – by applying both energy engineering modeling ( evaluating phase ) for the existing green sidewalk and statistical energy modeling ( predicting phase ) for the new one – to offer algorithms that help to catch the optimum morphology of green sidewalk , in case of high quality of the outdoor thermal comfort and less error in result .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The tool of the study are the way of processing by SML , predicting the future based on the past .', 'Machine learning is benefited from Python advantage .', 'The structure of the study consisted of two main part , as the majority of the similar study follow : engineering energy modeling and statistical energy modeling .', 'According to the concept of the study , at first , from 2268 model , some are randomly selected , simulated and sensitively analyzed by ENVI-met .', 'Furthermore , the Envi-met output as the quantity of thermal comfort – predicted mean vote ( PMV ) and weather item are input of Python .', 'Then , the formed data set is processed by SML , to reach the final reliable predicted output .', 'Finding : The process of SML leads the study to find thermal comfort of current model and other similar sidewalk .', 'The result are evaluated by both PMV mathematical model and SML error evaluation function .', 'The result confirm that the average of the occurred error is about 1 % .', 'Then the method of study is reliable to apply in the variety of similar field .', 'Finding of this study can be helpful in perspective of the sustainable architecture strategy in the building and urban scale , to determine , monitor and control energy-based behavior ( thermal comfort , heating , cooling , lighting and ventilation ) in operational phase of the system ( existed element in building , and construction ) and the planning and designing phase of the future built case – all over their life span .', 'Research limitations/implications : Limitation of the study are related to the study variable and alternative that are notable impact on the finding .', 'Furthermore , the most trustable input data will result in the more accuracy in output .', 'Then modeling and simulation process are most significant part of the research to reach the exact result in the final step .', 'Practical implication : Finding of the study can be helpful in urban design strategy .', 'By finding outdoor thermal comfort that resulted from machine learning method , urban and landscape designer , policymakers and architect are able to estimate the feature of their design in air quality and urban health and can be sure in catching design goal in case of thermal comfort in urban atmosphere .', 'Social implication : By 2030 , city are delved as living space for about three out of five people .', 'As green infrastructure influence in moderating the city ’ climate , the relationship between green space and habitant ’ thermal comfort is deduced .', 'Although the strategy to outside thermal comfort improvement , by design method and applicant , are not new subject to discuss , applying machine that may be common in predicting result can be called as a new insight in applying more effective design strategy and in urban environment ’ s comfort preparation .', 'Then study ’ s footprint in social implication stems in learning from the previous project and developing more efficient strategy to prepare city as the more comfortable and healthy place to live , with the more efficient model and consuming money and time .', 'Originality/value : The study achievement are expected to be applied not only in Tehran but also in other climate zone as the pattern in more eco-city design strategy .', 'Although some similar study are done in different major , the concept of study is new vision in urban study .', 'Predicting urban cold-air path using boosted regression tree .', 'Ensuring the transport of colder air mass from rural surroundings or inner urban open space into the dense urban center is a vital approach for reducing nocturnal warming of urban area in summer , i.e .', 'the urban heat island ( UHI ) effect .', 'Hence , cold-air path are an important mitigation aspect in urban planning .', 'The identification of cold-air path by field measurement , however , is time-consuming and it is difficult to cover larger spatial domain ( e.g .', 'entire city ) .', 'Therefore , we used a machine learning technique , boosted regression tree ( BRT ) , for estimating the spatial distribution of cold-air path in three German city ( Braunschweig , Freiburg , Stuttgart ) .', 'We identified the most important predictor variable for cold-air path occurrence and tested the spatial transferability of BRT model from one training city to the other study city .', 'Three variable explaining difference in surface elevation indicated strongest influence on spatial distribution of cold-air path : relative surface elevation , topographic position index , and topographic wind index .', 'We achieved prediction for the spatial distribution of cold-air path for city the model was trained on , resulting in model performance of 0.85 < AUC < 0.96 ( AUC : area under the receiver operating characteristic curve ) .', 'Model transfer to other city , however , achieved only poor to moderate result ( 0.5 < AUC < 0.8 ) .', 'The city of Freiburg tended to be the most suitable basis for a general model , since it covers the largest range of condition .', 'Transfer works best for ‘ similar ’ city , i.e .', 'city with a comparable range of predictor variable and morphological structure .', 'Cold-air path identification via BRT modelling appeared to be a promising method delivering helpful information for urban planning .', 'Examining threshold effect of built environment element on travel-related carbon-dioxide emission .', 'Understanding how built environment feature are associated with travel-related carbon-dioxide ( CO2 ) emission is essential for planner to encourage environmentally sustainable travel through transportation and land use policy .', 'Applying gradient boosting decision tree to the data from the Minneapolis-St. Paul metropolitan area , this study addresses two gap in the literature by identifying critical built environment determinant of CO2 emission , and more importantly , illustrating threshold effect of built environment element .', 'The result show that three neighborhood-level built environment factor have the strongest influence on CO2 emission : distance to the nearest transit stop , job density , and land use diversity .', 'The distance to downtown also has a substantial impact .', 'This study further confirms that built environment variable are effective only within a certain range .', 'These threshold effect offer valuable implication for planner to achieve desirable environmental benefit efficiently .', 'Quantifying the effect of urban form on land surface temperature in subtropical high-density urban area using machine learning .', 'It is widely acknowledged that urban form significantly affects urban thermal environment , which is a key element to adapt and mitigate extreme high temperature weather in high-density urban area .', 'However , few study have discussed the impact of physical urban form feature on the land surface temperature ( LST ) from a perspective of comprehensive urban spatial structure .', 'This study used the ordinary least-squares regression ( OLS ) and random forest regression ( RF ) to distinguish the relative contribution of urban form metric on LST at three observation scale .', 'Result of this study indicate that more than 90 % of the LST variation were explained by selected urban form metric using RF .', 'Effect of the magnitude and direction of urban form metric on LST varied with the change of season and observation scale .', 'Overall , building morphology and urban ecological infrastructure had dominant effect on LST variation in high-density urban center .', 'Urban green space and water body demonstrated stronger cooling effect , especially in summer .', 'Building density ( BD ) exhibited significant positive effect on LST , whereas the floor area ratio ( FAR ) showed a negative influence on LST .', 'The result can be applied to investigate and implement urban thermal environment mitigation planning for city manager and planner .', 'Identifying urban geometric type as energy performance pattern .', 'This paper aims to find the impact of geometric parameter on the energy performance of building , to using them to identify type regarding major geometric characteristic of a target area .', 'Conventional approach to control energy efficiency of building mainly focus on material and capacity of insulation , but rarely consider urban and building geometry .', 'By examining energy impact on urban block by urban geometric form , this paper seeks to identify urban geometric type and energy pattern on urban block .', 'To achieve the aim of this study , this paper follows two step : First , significant indicator for analyzing energy performance are identified in urban geometry ; second , the type that capture urban geometry of a real city are categorized .', 'As a result , as a reference for urban planning and design , the paper identifies 13 type that represent the characteristic of urban geometry regarding energy performance .', 'The geometric indicator are carefully measured and their significance to energy performance of building is examined through regression analysis .', 'According to these indicator , the 13 type are categorized using a hierarchical clustering algorithm , a machine learning method .', 'Additionally , the 13 type are discussed for implementation as reference in urban planning and design , particularly in block planning for a city .', 'Using particle swarm optimization method to optimize the carbon sequestration potential of agricultural afforestation in Beijing , China .', 'Agricultural afforestation is an important way to mitigate climate change and improve the environmental quality of city system .', 'The major restriction of planning agricultural afforestation program and optimize the carbon sequestration potential of these program is the decrease of food productivity .', 'The spatial heterogeneity of both the food productivity and carbon sequestration potential further complicate this problem .', 'In this article , we demonstrate how the particle swarm optimization ( PSO ) method can be formulated and applied to address this problem .', 'Based on the spatial estimation of food productivity and carbon sequestration potential , we formulated a PSO model to generate the optimal zoning of agricultural afforestation area and optimize the carbon sequestration potential with different scenario of food productivity decrease ratio in Beijing , China .', 'Result show that our method can be used to optimize the carbon sequestration potential of agricultural afforestation under the restriction of decrease in food productivity .', 'With the application of our method , a significantly higher carbon sequestration potential can be achieved with a small loss of the current food productivity , e.g .', '8.80-12.47 Tg C ( 14.82 - 20.93 % of the maximum carbon sequestration potential ) can be sequestrated with 5 % loss of current food productivity .', 'This research highlights the application of machine learning at the high level of smart city management to improve the efficacy and intelligence of urban planning .', 'Investigating important urban characteristic in the formation of urban heat island : a machine learning approach .', 'Despite the urban heat island phenomenon has long been recognized as a major urban environmental problem , it was not until recently that this urban phenomenon gained attention from the discipline of urban planning .', 'To integrate the finding of the urban heat island research into the planning practice , the relationship between land surface temperature and urban physical and socioeconomic characteristic should be addressed at the planning relevant spatial scale , a land parcel .', 'Using a parcel as a unit of analysis , this study proposed to use a machine learning approach to identify important variable in the formation of urban heat island in Indianapolis , Indiana .', 'Applying random forest method to planning zone , this study identified planning zone specific urban physical and socioeconomic characteristic that are important for the interpretation of urban heat island phenomenon of Indianapolis , Indiana .', 'The main contribution of this study is twofold : to integrate urban physical and socioeconomic characteristic into a land parcel for the better interpretation of the result of urban heat island study into planning practice and to apply machine learning approach to identify highly determinant variable in the formation of urban heat island .', 'Development of an urban high-resolution air temperature forecast system for localweather information service based on statistical downscaling .', 'The Korean peninsula has complex and diverse weather phenomena , and the Korea Meteorological Administration has been working on various numerical model to produce better forecasting data .', 'The Unified Model Local Data Assimilation and Prediction System is a limited-area working model with a horizontal resolution of 1.5 km for estimating local-scale weather forecast on the Korean peninsula .', 'However , in order to numerically predict the detailed temperature characteristic of the urban space , in which surface characteristic change rapidly in a small spatial area , a city temperature prediction model with higher resolution spatial decomposition capability is required .', 'As an alternative to this , a building-scale temperature model was developed , and a 25 m air temperature resolution was determined for the Seoul area .', 'The spatial information was processed using statistical method , such as linear regression model and machine learning .', 'By comparing the accuracy of the estimated air temperature with observational data during the summer , the machine learning was improved .', 'In addition , horizontal and vertical characteristic of the urban space were better represented , and the air temperature was better resolved spatially .', 'Air temperature information can be used to manage the response to heat-waves and tropical night in administrative district of urban area .', 'The effect of multi-dimensional indicator on urban thermal condition .', 'Urban heat island ( UHI ) study have recognized ten factor as increasing the inner-city temperature compared with that of the surrounding suburbs .', 'The UHI effect is a leading cause of heat-related disease and mortality in many nation .', 'However , there are still two main shortcoming .', 'First , the effect of UHI is not well recognized in arid and semi-arid region .', 'Second , the association of multi-dimensional information with surface temperature in urban area must be examined .', 'This study focuses on the height-related aspect of urban geometry in an arid region .', 'A range of multispectral and spatial vector data were used to derive the surface temperature and two-dimensional ( 2D ) and three-dimensional ( 3D ) information of the study area .', 'All information was aggregated into a grid with common spatial resolution to create a homogeneous dataset .', 'The machine learning statistical model of a boosted regression tree ( BRT ) was used to reflect the relative influence of 2D and 3D indicator with land surface temperature .', 'Our result showed a cooler surface temperature in the city than in the surrounding area , leading to the question of whether the established UHI definition encompasses all type of city .', 'In addition , the thermal band was able to distinguish different spatial structure in the study area .', 'The BRT analysis demonstrated that both multi-dimensional 2D and 3D indicator affect the surface temperature .', 'In particular , the 3D indicator play a more important role than 2D indicator in shaping the surface temperature at different urban geometry of the study area .', 'This new method can help urban planner identify the most influential 2D and 3D indicator that affect the surface temperature in different district of a city .', 'Multi-scale modeling of territorial dynamic of geospatial anthropogenic energy consumption .', 'Objective : The development of any region or territory stems from its own dynamic nature .', 'Distribution and consumption of energy resource are varied territorially which in turn is ruled by the number of anthropogenic activity in association with geospatial localization .', 'Such territorial dynamic necessitate considerable modification of the energy infrastructure .', 'Thus , the development of a computational multi-scale unified energy consumption model with the usage of geographic information helps in automating data analysis processes for sustainable urban planning , allocation of energy-saving infrastructure , and strategic deployment of the renewable energy resource to finely regulate the utilization of energy resource for sustainable energy consumption .', 'Method : The integration of city-wide energy system model and geographic information system ( GIS ) is still in its infancy .', 'The research work is divided into five interrelated work package .', 'The Modelling problem is achieved with the help of analytical hierarchical process .', 'Thus , we propose a computational infrastructure for modelling city-wide geospatial energy consumption and automating the data analysis process to provide the sustainable environmental policy , which requires artificial intelligence-based geospatial aware comprehensive planning , regarding the modification of the energy supply , consumption , activity , and infrastructure in city .', 'Result and Discussion : Thus , end result of the presented research work is fine-grained energy demand estimation from data source , decentralized storage facility , and automated sustainable planning ; investigation of GIS-based anthropogenic activity or mobility pattern influencing the wastage of energy resource , the transition from purely structural to operational planning , and , finally , the development of a new dynamic-based power market design .', 'Combined gis , cfd and neural network multi-zone model for urban planning and building simulation .', 'This study developed a methodology using Geographic Information System ( GIS ) , Computational Fluid Dynamics ( CFD ) and neural network to help predict the microclimate of the building .', 'The geographic representation of an urban area in Syracuse generated in GIS was converted to the computational domain used in CFD simulation .', 'The flow field around the building was simulated using the CFD model under different wind speed and direction .', 'Result from CFD simulation could be well presented in GIS using anchored coordinate system .', 'The flow pattern were very similar when the wind speed was varied , while they were highly dependent on the wind direction .', 'However , predicting the flow field of different wind direction requires running the CFD simulation for each case .', 'A neural network for machine learning was adopted to help predict the microclimate around the building so that much time can be saved .', 'The result show that the proposed neural network has the potential to help predict the microclimate .', 'The predicted microclimate could be used for further study of the building performance .', 'An Evaluation Index for Cross Ventilation Based on CFD Simulations and Ventilation Prediction Model Using Machine Learning algorithms .', 'High-density city usually surfer deterioration of the urban built environment due to slow or stagnant air movement .', 'This deterioration could be mitigated by improved urban natural ventilation through good urban planning and building design .', 'However , indoor natural ventilation requirement in current building standard only define absolute indoor air speed without considering outdoor condition .', 'To fill this gap , this paper developed generic urban-scale coupled indoor and outdoor CFD model and proposes a new integrated index ( CIOI index ) to evaluate indoor natural ventilation potential , which couples both indoor and outdoor wind environment .', 'CIOIv regression model are developed by applying machine learning algorithm based on 3,840 CFD simulation result .', 'The Gradient Boosting ( GB ) model shows an improved performance in term of higher correlation ( R2=0.8 ) and lower error ( MAPE=16 % ) compared with the multivariate linear regression model .', 'Building designer and urban planner can use this CIOI prediction model to quickly check , in the early design stage , the influence of their design variation on indoor ventilation potential .', 'Published by Elsevier Ltd .', 'Thermal sensation prediction by soft computing methodology .', 'Thermal comfort in open urban area is very factor based on environmental point of view .', 'Therefore it is need to fulfill demand for suitable thermal comfort during urban planning and design .', 'Thermal comfort can be modeled based on climatic parameter and other factor .', 'The factor are variable and they are changed throughout the year and day .', 'Therefore there is need to establish an algorithm for thermal comfort prediction according to the input variable .', 'The prediction result could be used for planning of time of usage of urban area .', 'Since it is very nonlinear task , in this investigation was applied soft computing methodology in order to predict the thermal comfort .', 'The main goal was to apply extreme leaning machine ( ELM ) for forecasting of physiological equivalent temperature ( PET ) value .', 'Temperature , pressure , wind speed and irradiance were used as input .', 'The prediction result are compared with some benchmark model .', 'Based on the result ELM can be used effectively in forecasting of PET .']

['A comprehensive study of the COVID-19 impact on PM2.5 level over the contiguous United States : A deep learning approach .', 'We investigate the impact of the COVID-19 outbreak on PM2.5 level in eleven urban environment across the United States : Washington DC , New York , Boston , Chicago , Los Angeles , Houston , Dallas , Philadelphia , Detroit , Phoenix , and Seattle .', 'We estimate daily PM2.5 level over the contiguous U.S. in March–May 2019 and 2020 , and leveraging a deep convolutional neural network , we find a correlation coefficient , an index of agreement , a mean absolute bias , and a root mean square error of 0.90 ( 0.90 ) , 0.95 ( 0.95 ) , 1.34 ( 1.24 ) μg/m3 , and 2.04 ( 1.87 ) μg/m3 , respectively .', 'Result from Google Community Mobility Reports and estimated PM2.5 concentration show a greater reduction of PM2.5 in region with larger decrease in human mobility and those in which individual remain in their residential area longer .', 'The relationship between vehicular PM2.5 ( i.e.', ', the ratio of vehicular PM2.5 to other source of PM2.5 ) emission and PM2.5 reduction ( R = 0.77 ) in various region indicates that region with higher emission of vehicular PM2.5 generally experience greater decrease in PM2.5 .', 'While most of the urban environment ⸺ Washington DC , New York , Boston , Chicago , Los Angeles , Houston , Dallas , Philadelphia , Detroit , and Seattle ⸺ show a decrease in PM2.5 level by 21.1 % , 20.7 % , 18.5 % , 8.05 % , 3.29 % , 3.63 % , 6.71 % , 4.82 % , 13.5 % , and 7.73 % , respectively , between March–May of 2020 and 2019 , Phoenix shows a 5.5 % increase during the same period .', 'Similar to their PM2.5 reduction , Washington DC , New York , and Boston , compared to other city , exhibit the highest reduction in human mobility and the highest vehicular PM2.5 emission , highlighting the great impact of human activity on PM2.5 change in eleven region .', 'Moreover , compared to change in meteorological factor , change in pollutant concentration , including those of black carbon , organic carbon , SO2 , SO4 , and especially NO2 , appear to have had a significantly greater impact on PM2.5 change during the study period .', 'A hybrid Daily PM2.5 concentration prediction model based on secondary decomposition algorithm , mode recombination technique and deep learning .', 'Accurate and effective PM2.5 concentration prediction has important implication for public health and the ecological environment .', "To provide more accurate early warning for haze prevention , urban planning , and people 's travel planning , this paper proposes a new combined PM2.5 concentration prediction model .", 'Firstly , the original sequence is decomposed by complete ensemble empirical mode decomposition with adaptive noise ( CEEMDAN ) , followed by decomposition and reconstruction of the data by adaptive variational mode decomposition ( AVMD ) and sample entropy ( SE ) , and then the reconstructed subseries are predicted by long and short-term memory network ( LSTM ) .', 'The empirical analysis was carried out with three datasets from Beijing , Tianjin , and Baoding , and the following conclusion can be drawn : ( 1 ) The validity and robustness of the proposed model were verified , with R2 ( 0.982 ) , RMSE ( 2.792 ) , and MAPE ( 9.088 % ) being optimal in all comparison experiment .', '( 2 ) The incorporation of secondary decomposition and pattern reorganization algorithms can effectively handle data with high volatility and non-linearity .', '( 3 ) Compared with traditional machine learning model , the long and short-term memory network is more suitable for time series prediction .', 'The model provides a novel and effective PM2.5 concentration prediction tool for the government and the public .', 'Spatio-temporal prediction and factor identification of urban air quality using support vector machine .', 'Accurate air quality prediction can provide better supervision and reference for management policy .', 'Due to difficulty in data acquisition , combined spatio-temporal prediction is still inconclusive .', 'This study utilizes the support vector
