machine ( SVM ) method to predict air quality of unknown space and time .', 'Extracted from a geographic information system ( GIS ) , geographic feature such as population , land use , economy , pollution source , and terrain parameter were added to a time series .', 'Temporal prediction was first executed in the reference station , and the predicted air quality index ( AQI ) was then used to spatially infer the future AQI of unknown location .', 'Verification indicated high accuracy for short-term temporal prediction .', 'Various meteorological and climatic effect were observed to be influential in seasonal difference .', 'In the spatial inference stage , urbanization and city type were spatial feature that appeared to impact air quality .', 'Agriculture and forest use , transportation use , residential use , and economic factor were clearly correlated to AQIs , whereas population and labor force were not .', 'This study establishes a prediction framework in northern Taipei based on SVM .', 'Other location can build their own model based on local actual data to achieve better decision-making , urban planning , or other application .', 'Machine-learning model to replicate large-eddy simulation of air pollutant concentration along boulevard-type street .', 'Running large-eddy simulation ( LESs ) can be burdensome and computationally too expensive from the application point of view , for example , to support urban planning .', 'In this study , regression model are used to replicate modelled air pollutant concentration from LES in urban boulevard .', 'We study the performance of regression model and discuss how to detect situation where the model are applied outside their training domain and their output can not be trusted .', 'Regression model from 10 different model family are trained and a cross-validation methodology is used to evaluate their performance and to find the best set of feature needed to reproduce the LES output .', 'We also test the regression model on an independent testing dataset .', 'Our result suggest that in general , log-linear regression gives the best and most robust performance on new independent data .', 'It clearly outperforms the dummy model which would predict constant concentration for all location ( multiplicative minimum RMSE ( mRMSE ) of 0.76 vs. 1.78 of the dummy model ) .', 'Furthermore , we demonstrate that it is possible to detect concept drift , i.e .', 'situation where the model is applied outside its training domain and a new LES run may be necessary to obtain reliable result .', 'Regression model can be used to replace LES simulation in estimating air pollutant concentration , unless higher accuracy is needed .', 'In order to have reliable result , it is however important to do the model and feature selection carefully to avoid overfitting and to use method to detect the concept drift .', 'National Empirical Models of Air Pollution Using Microscale Measures of the Urban Environment .', 'National-scale empirical model of air pollution ( e.g.', ', Land Use Regression ) rely on predictor variable ( e.g.', ', population density , land cover ) at different geographic scale .', 'These model typically lack microscale variable ( e.g.', ', street level ) , which may improve prediction with fine-spatial gradient .', 'We developed microscale variable of the urban environment including Point of Interest ( POI ) data , Google Street View ( GSV ) imagery , and satellite-based measure of urban form .', 'We developed United States national model for six criterion pollutant ( NO2 , PM2.5 , O3 , CO , PM10 , SO2 ) using various modeling approach : Stepwise Regression + kriging ( SW-K ) , Partial Least Squares + kriging ( PLS-K ) , and Machine Learning + kriging ( ML-K ) .', 'We compared predictor variable ( e.g.', ', traditional vs microscale ) and emerging modeling approach ( ML-K ) to well-established approach ( i.e.', ', traditional variable in a PLS-K or SW-K framework ) .', 'We found that combined predictor variable ( traditional + microscale ) in the ML-K model outperformed the well-established approach ( 10-fold spatial cross-validation ( CV ) R2 increased 0.02-0.42 [ average : 0.19 ] among six criterion pollutant ) .', 'Comparing all model type using microscale variable to model with traditional variable , the performance is similar ( average difference of 10-fold spatial CV R2 = 0.05 ) suggesting microscale variable are a suitable substitute for traditional variable .', 'ML-K and microscale variable show promise for improving national empirical model .', 'Nonlinear relationship between urban form and street-level PM2.5 and CO based on mobile measurement and gradient boosting decision tree model .', 'Exposure to PM2.5 and CO has been proven to be closely related to physical health .', 'Since 2012 , they have been added to the pollutant list for national monitoring in Wuhan .', 'However , the fine-scale variation in pollution , especially at the street level , is complex and requires further exploration .', 'In this study , the influence of urban form on the street-level air pollution distribution was comprehensively assessed according to the urban factor , high-resolution meteorological data , PM2.5 and CO concentration data collected via mobile monitoring along road in Wuhan .', 'Furthermore , potential urban factor , including the land-use and urban form characteristic , were obtained from geographic information system .', 'Both linear regression and gradient boosting decision tree ( GBDT ) model were developed to explore the relationship between the observed concentration and the predictor variable .', 'The modeling result demonstrate that the GBDT model , which captured the non-linear relationship , helps to better explain more of the variation in the pollutant concentration than the linear model .', 'This study provides insight into machine learning model for pollution prediction and demonstrate the important relationship between urban form and street-level pollutant .', 'The result suggest that the urban form of the podium-level porosity can be set higher than 0.7 to promote the ventilation of street-level PM2.5 and CO , building density can be less than 0.35 , and the standard deviation of height can be set to ~10 m in central Wuhan to mitigate street-level PM2.5 .', 'Thus , quantitatively demonstrating the impact of urban form on the PM2.5 and CO concentration can help decision-makers with urban planning and management .', 'Demystifying uncertainty in PM10 susceptibility mapping using variable drop-off in extreme-gradient boosting ( XGB ) and random forest ( RF ) algorithms .', 'This study investigates uncertainty in machine learning that can occur when there is significant variance in the prediction importance level of the independent variable , especially when the ROC fails to reflect the unbalanced effect of prediction variable .', 'A variable drop-off loop function , based on the concept of early termination for reduction of model capacity , regularization , and generalization control , was tested .', 'A susceptibility index for airborne particulate matter of less than 10 μm diameter ( PM10 ) was modeled using monthly maximum value and spectral band and index from Landsat 8 imagery , and Open Street Maps were used to prepare a range of independent variable .', 'Probability and classification index map were prepared using extreme-gradient boosting ( XGBOOST ) and random forest ( RF ) algorithms .', 'These were assessed against utility criterion such as a confusion matrix of overall accuracy , quantity of variable , processing delay , degree of overfitting , importance distribution , and area under the receiver operating characteristic curve ( ROC ) .', 'Graphical abstract : [ Figure not available : see fulltext . ]', 'Designing roadside green infrastructure to mitigate traffic-related air pollution using machine learning .', 'Community located in near-road environment are exposed to traffic-related air pollution ( TRAP ) , causing adverse health effect .', 'While roadside vegetation barrier can help mitigate TRAP , their effectiveness to reduce TRAP is influenced by site-specific condition .', 'To test vegetation design using direct field measurement or high-fidelity numerical simulation is often infeasible since urban planner and local community often lack the access and expertise to use those tool .', 'There is a need for a fast , reliable , and easy-to-use method to evaluate vegetation barrier design based on their capacity to mitigate TRAP .', 'In this paper , we investigated five machine learning ( ML ) method , including linear regression ( LR ) , support vector machine ( SVM ) , random forest ( RF ) , XGBoost ( XGB ) , and neural network ( NN ) , to predict size-resolved and locationally dependent particle concentration downwind of various vegetation barrier design .', 'Data from 83 computational fluid dynamic ( CFD ) simulation was used to train and test the ML model .', 'We developed downwind region-specific model to capture the complexity of this problem and enhance the overall accuracy .', 'Our feature space was composed of variable that can be feasibly obtained such as vegetation width , height , leaf area index ( LAI ) , particle size , leaf area density ( LAD ) and wind speed at different height .', 'RF , NN , and XGB performed well with a normalized root mean square error ( NRMSE ) of 6–7 % and an average test R2 value & gt ; 0.91 , while SVM and LR had an NRMSE of approximately 13 % and an average test R2 value of 0.56 .', 'Using feature selection , vegetation dimension and particle size had the highest influence in predicting pollutant concentration .', 'The ML model developed can help create tool to aid local community in developing mitigation strategy to address TRAP problem .', 'Predictive model using “ cheap and easy ” field measurement : Can they fill a gap in planning , monitoring , and implementing fecal sludge management solution ?', '.', 'The characteristic of fecal sludge delivered to treatment plant are highly variable .', 'Adapting treatment process operation accordingly is challenging due to a lack of analytical capacity for characterization and monitoring at many treatment plant .', 'Cost-efficient and simple field measurement such as photographs and probe reading could be proxy for process control parameter that normally require laboratory analysis .', 'To investigate this , we evaluated questionnaire data , expert assessment , and simple analytical measurement for fecal sludge collected from 421 onsite containment .', 'This data served as input to model of varying complexity .', 'Random forest and linear regression model were able to predict physical-chemical characteristic including total solid ( TS ) and ammonium ( NH4+-N ) concentration , and solid-liquid separation performance including settling efficiency and filtration time ( R2 from 0.51-0.66 ) based on image analysis of photographs ( sludge color , supernatant color , and texture ) and probe reading ( conductivity ( EC ) and pH ) .', 'Supernatant color was the best predictor of settling efficiency and filtration time , EC was the best predictor of NH4+-N , and texture was the best predictor of TS .', 'Predictive model have the potential to be applied for real-time monitoring and process control if a database of measurement is developed and model are validated in other city .', 'Simple decision tree model based on the single classifier of containment type can also be used to make prediction about citywide planning , where a lower degree of accuracy is required .', 'Research on Seasonal PM 2.5 Predication in Hangzhou City Based on SSA-ELM Model .', 'PM2.5 concentration is the main factor of air pollution , and accurate prediction of PM2.5 concentration can provide better preventive measure for urban governance .', 'This paper selects the pollutant data and meteorological data of Hangzhou from 2016 to 2020 to analyze the influence of seasonal factor , pollutant factor and meteorological factor on PM2.5 concentration in Hangzhou .', 'The result show that the concentration of PM2.5 varies significantly in different season , so this paper adopts the method of seasonal prediction .', 'The Pearson correlation index is used to select the influence factor strongly related to the PM2.5 concentration value as the input variable of the model .', 'Using Particle Swarm Optimization Random Forest ( PSO-RF ) , Particle Swarm Optimization BP neural network ( PSO-BP ) and Sparrow Search Algorithm Extreme Learning Machine ( SSA-ELM ) model to predict Hangzhou PM2.5 concentration value in the four season of the city .', 'Through the performance comparison of Root Mean Square Error ( RMSE ) , Mean Absolute Error ( MAE ) and coefficient of certainty ( R2 ) , the result show that the prediction performance of SSA-ELM model is better than other model .', 'In different season forecast , the error value corresponding to summer is the smallest , R2 is higher , and the fitting effect is the best .', 'A hybrid air pollutant concentration prediction model combining secondary decomposition and sequence reconstruction .', 'Acid rain is a serious threat to terrestrial ecosystem .', 'To provide more accurate early warning information for acid rain prevention , urban planning , and travel planning , a novel air pollutant prediction model was proposed in this paper to predict NO2 and SO2 .', 'First , the data were decomposed into several sub-sequences by a complete ensemble empirical mode decomposition with adaptive noise .', 'Second , the subsequence are reconstructed by variational mode decomposition and sample entropy .', 'Then , the new subsequence are predicted by the extreme learning machine combined with the whale optimization algorithm .', 'The empirical analysis was carried out through 8 data set .', 'According to the experimental result , three main conclusion can be drawn .', 'First , the proposed model in this paper has excellent prediction performance and robustness .', 'In all the comparison experiment , the R2 and RMSE of the proposed model are the best among all the model .', 'Second , data preprocessing is very necessary .', 'After adding the decomposition algorithm , the average improvement level of R2 and RMSE were 897.57 % and 50.78 % , respectively .', 'Third , the re-decomposition of IMF1 is an effective method to improve prediction accuracy .', 'After the re-decomposition of IMF1 , R2 can be improved by 13.64 % on average on the original basis , and RMSE can be reduced by 31.99 % on average .', 'The result of this study can provide a valuable reference for the research of air pollutant prediction .', 'In future work , the application of the proposed model in other air pollutant or other region can be explored .', 'High-resolution spatiotemporal measurement of air and environmental noise pollution in Sub-Saharan African city : Pathway to Equitable Health Cities Study protocol for Accra , Ghana .', 'Introduction Air and noise pollution are emerging environmental health hazard in African city , with potentially complex spatial and temporal pattern .', 'Limited local data are a barrier to the formulation and evaluation of policy to reduce air and noise pollution .', 'Method and analysis We designed a year-long measurement campaign to characterise air and noise pollution and their source at high-resolution within the Greater Accra Metropolitan Area ( GAMA ) , Ghana .', 'Our design uses a combination of fixed ( year-long , n=10 ) and rotating ( week-long , n =∼130 ) sites , selected to represent a range of land us and source influence ( eg , background , road traffic , commercial , industrial and residential area , and various neighbourhood socioeconomic class ) .', 'We will collect data on fine particulate matter ( PM 2.5 ) , nitrogen oxide ( NO x ) , weather variable , sound ( noise level and audio ) along with street-level time-lapse image .', 'We deploy low-cost , low-power , lightweight monitoring device that are robust , socially unobtrusive , and able to function in Sub-Saharan African ( SSA ) climate .', 'We will use state-of-the-art method , including spatial statistic , deep/machine learning , and processed-based emission modelling , to capture highly resolved temporal and spatial variation in pollution level across the GAMA and to identify their potential source .', 'This protocol can serve as a prototype for other SSA city .', 'Ethic and dissemination This environmental study was deemed exempt from full ethic review at Imperial College London and the University of Massachusetts Amherst ; it was approved by the University of Ghana Ethics Committee ( ECH 149/18-19 ) .', 'This protocol is designed to be implementable in SSA city to map environmental pollution to inform urban planning decision to reduce health harming exposure to air and noise pollution .', 'It will be disseminated through local stakeholder engagement ( public and private sector ) , peer-reviewed publication , contribution to policy document , medium , and conference presentation .', 'Investigation of the impact of land-use distribution on pm2.5 in weifang : Seasonal variation .', 'As air pollution becomes highly focused in China , the accurate identification of its influencing factor is critical for achieving effective control and targeted environmental governance .', 'Land-use distribution is one of the key factor affecting air quality , and research on the impact of land-use distribution on air pollution has drawn wide attention .', 'However , considerable study have mostly used linear regression model , which fail to capture the nonlinear effect of land-use distribution on PM2.5 ( fine particulate matter with a diameter less than or equal to 2.5 micron ) and to show how impact on PM2.5 vary with land-use magnitude .', 'In addition , related study have generally focused on annual analysis , ignoring the seasonal variability of the impact of land-use distribution on PM2.5 , thus leading to possible estimation bias for PM2.5 .', 'This study was designed to address these issue and assess the impact of land-use distribution on PM2.5 in Weifang , China .', 'A machine learning statistical model , the boosted regression tree ( BRT ) , was applied to measure nonlinear effect of land-use distribution on PM2.5 , capture how land-use magnitude impact PM2.5 across different season , and explore the policy implication for urban planning .', 'The main conclusion are that the air quality will significantly improve with an increase in grassland and forest area , especially below 8 % and 20 % , respectively .', 'When the distribution of construction land is greater than around 10 % , the PM2.5 pollution can be seriously substantially increased with the increment of their area .', 'The impact of garden and farmland present seasonal characteristic .', 'It is noted that as the weather becomes colder , the inhibitory effect of vegetation distribution on the PM2.5 concentration gradually decreases , while the positive impact of artificial surface distribution , such as construction land and road , are aggravated because leaf drop off in autumn ( September–November ) and winter ( December–February ) .', 'According to the finding of this study , it is recommended that Weifang should strengthen pollution control in winter , for instance , expand the coverage area of evergreen vegetation like Pinus bungeana Zucc .', 'and Euonymus japonicus Thunb , and increase the width and number of branch connecting different main road .', 'The finding also provide quantitative and optimal land-use planning and strategy to minimize PM2.5 pollution , referring to the status of regional urbanization and greening construction .', 'Characterizing air quality in urban area with mobile measurement and high resolution open spatial data : Comparison of different machine-learning approach using a visual interface .', 'Air quality is one of the most important topic in our urban life , as it is of great significance for human health and urban planning .', 'However , accurate assessment and prediction of air quality in urban area are difficult .', 'In major city , typically only a limited number of air quality monitoring station are available , and inferring air quality in the un-sampled area throughout the city is challenging .', 'On the other hand , air quality varies in the urban area non-linearly ; it is highly spatially dependent and considerably influenced by multiple factor , such as building distribution , traffic situation and land us .', 'In this research , we model air quality in the city of Augsburg using spatial feature and high quality sensor data .', 'We identify spatial feature such as type and area of different land us , road network with high resolution .', 'We integrate open available data to the air quality prediction .', 'In this regard , we compare a simple baseline model with linear regression model ( Ordinary Least-squares and Ridge Regression ) and tree-based machine-learning model ( Gradient Boosting and Random Forest ) .', 'In our evaluation , given the non-linearity of the data , tree-based model outperform all linear model , which are commonly used in literature .', 'In addition , we created an interactive and visual dashboard .', 'This dashboard demonstrates the analytical workflow , gives insight into model performance and uncertainty and visualizes the result .', 'Mining and Analysis of Air Quality Data to Aid Climate Change .', 'The data science and AI community has gathered around the world to support tackling the climate change problem in different domain .', 'This research aims to work on the air quality through emission and pollutant concentration data along with vegetation information .', 'Authority especially in urban city like London have been very vigilant in monitoring these different aspect of air quality and reliable source of big data are available in this domain .', 'This study aims to mine and collate this information spread all over the place in different format into usable knowledge base on which further data analysis and powerful Machine Learning approach can be built to extract strong evidence useful in building better policy around climate change .', 'Using a gradient boosting model to improve the performance of low-cost aerosol monitor in a dense , heterogeneous urban environment .', 'The increased availability and improved quality of new sensing technology have catalyzed a growing body of research to evaluate and leverage these tool in order to quantify and describe urban environment .', 'Air quality , in particular , has received greater attention because of the well-established link to serious respiratory illness and the unprecedented level of air pollution in developed and developing country and city around the world .', 'Though numerous laboratory and field evaluation study have begun to explore the use and potential of low-cost air quality monitoring device , the performance and stability of these tool has not been adequately evaluated in complex urban environment , and further research is needed .', 'In this study , we present the design of a low-cost air quality monitoring platform based on the Shinyei PPD42 aerosol monitor and examine the suitability of the sensor for deployment in a dense heterogeneous urban environment .', "We assess the sensor 's performance during a field calibration campaign from February 7th to March 25th 2017 with a reference instrument in New York City , and present a novel calibration approach using a machine learning method that incorporates publicly available meteorological data in order to improve overall sensor performance .", 'We find that while the PPD42 performs well in relation to the reference instrument using linear regression ( R2 = 0.36–0.51 ) , a gradient boosting regression tree model can significantly improve device calibration ( R2 = 0.68–0.76 ) .', "We discuss the sensor 's performance and reliability when deployed in a dense , heterogeneous urban environment during a period of significant variation in weather condition , and important consideration when using machine learning technique to improve the performance of low-cost air quality monitor .", 'Forecasting smog-related health hazard based on social medium and physical sensor .', 'Smog disaster are becoming more and more frequent and may cause severe consequence on the environment and public health , especially in urban area .', 'Social medium as a real-time urban data source has become an increasingly effective channel to observe people׳s reaction on smog-related health hazard .', 'It can be used to capture possible smog-related public health disaster in its early stage .', 'We then propose a predictive analytic approach that utilizes both social medium and physical sensor data to forecast the next day smog-related health hazard .', 'First , we model smog-related health hazard and smog severity through mining raw microblogging text and network information diffusion data .', 'Second , we developed an artificial neural network ( ANN ) -based model to forecast smog-related health hazard with the current health hazard and smog severity observation .', 'We evaluate the performance of the approach with other alternative machine learning method .', 'To the best of our knowledge , we are the first to integrate social medium and physical sensor data for smog-related health hazard forecasting .', 'The empirical finding can help researcher to better understand the non-linear relationship between the current smog observation and the next day health hazard .', 'In addition , this forecasting approach can provide decision support for smog-related health hazard management through function like early warning .', 'ESANN 2017 - Proceeding , 25th European Symposium on Artificial Neural Networks , Computational Intelligence and Machine Learning .', 'The proceeding contain 98 paper .', 'The topic discussed include : environmental signal processing : new trend and application ; biomedical data analysis in translational research : integration of expert knowledge and interpretable model ; processing , mining and visualizing massive urban data ; algorithmic challenge in big data analytics ; distance metric learning : a two-phase approach ; learning null space projection fast ; a multi-criteria meta-learning method to select under-sampling algorithms for imbalanced datasets ; and a novel principle for causal inference in data with small error variance .']

['Towards a Multi-agents Model for Automatic Big Data Processing to Support Urban Planning .', 'The objective of this paper was to propose a multi-agents model for automating big data processing , to improve the process of decision-making and urban planning .', 'The huge amount of collected data from different domain , such as urban management and remote sensing , are characterized as big data with a spatial component .', 'Smart data is the approach to deal with big data characteristic and challenge by focusing on the Value aspect .', 'The focus on smart data on the relevant data and the mechanism of automation and collaboration of the agent , will contribute to the efficient automating for big data analytics and processing .', 'The proposed approach is based on a collection of agent , and adopt the concept of smart data , this paradigm focus on the aspect value from the big data and help to retrieve the useful information from the large volume of data by intelligent processing .', 'The proposed model describes the functionality of the agent .', 'The agent receive data in real time , perform the operation of storing data , pre-processing , streaming processing and batch processing and finally transfer the result of analysis to the service and application .', 'Machine learning technique can be used to enhance the aspect of cognition of the agent ; through a case study , we used supervised learning method to build a classification model to support the process of urban planning by predicting the type of habitat adequate for the population based on their demographic and socio-economic characteristic .', 'Intelligent control system in urban planning conflict : Social medium user ’ perception .', 'The relevance of this study is determined by the need to develop technology for effective urban system management and resolution of urban planning conflict .', 'The paper presents an algorithm for analyzing urban planning conflict .', 'The material for the study was data from social network , microblogging , blog , instant messaging , forum , review , video hosting service , thematic portal , online medium , print medium and TV related to the construction of the North-Eastern Chord ( NEC ) in Moscow ( RF ) .', 'To analyze the content of social medium , a multimodal approach was used .', 'The paper presents the result of research on the development of method and approach for constructing mathematical and neural network model for analyzing the social medium user ’ perception based on their digital footprint .', 'Artificial neural network , differential equation , and mathematical statistic were involved in building the model .', 'Differential equation of dynamic system were based on observation enabled by machine learning .', 'Mathematical model were developed to quickly detect , prevent , and address conflict in urban planning in order to manage urban system efficiently .', 'In combination with mathematical and neural network model the developed approach , made it possible to draw a conclusion about the tense situation around the construction of the NEC , identify complaint of resident to constructor and city authority , and propose recommendation to resolve and prevent conflict .', 'Research data could be of use in solving similar problem in sociology , ecology , and economics .', 'Learning from urban form to predict building height .', 'Understanding city as complex system , sustainable urban planning depends on reliable high-resolution data , for example of the building stock to upscale region-wide retrofit policy .', 'For some city and region , these data exist in detailed 3D model based on real-world measurement .', 'However , they are still expensive to build and maintain , a significant challenge , especially for small and medium-sized city that are home to the majority of the European population .', 'New method are needed to estimate relevant building stock characteristic reliably and cost-effectively .', 'Here , we present a machine learning based method for predicting building height , which is based only on open-access geospatial data on urban form , such as building footprint and street network .', 'The method allows to predict building height for region where no dedicated 3D model exist currently .', 'We train our model using building data from four European country ( France , Italy , the Netherlands , and Germany ) and find that the morphology of the urban fabric surrounding a given building is highly predictive of the height of the building .', 'A test on the German state of Brandenburg shows that our model predicts building height with an average error well below the typical floor height ( about 2.5 m ) , without having access to training data from Germany .', 'Furthermore , we show that even a small amount of local height data obtained by citizen substantially improves the prediction accuracy .', 'Our result illustrate the possibility of predicting missing data on urban infrastructure ; they also underline the value of open government data and volunteered geographic information for scientific application , such as contextual but scalable strategy to mitigate climate change .', 'This is an open access article distributed under the term of the Creative Commons Attribution License , which permits unrestricted use , distribution , and reproduction in any medium , provided the original author and source are credited .', 'BISTRO : Berkeley Integrated System for Transportation Optimization .', 'The current trend toward urbanization and adoption of flexible and innovative mobility technology will have complex and difficult-to-predict effect on urban transportation system .', 'Comprehensive methodological framework that account for the increasingly uncertain future state of the urban mobility landscape do not yet exist .', 'Furthermore , few approach have enabled the massive ingestion of urban data in planning tool capable of offering the flexibility of scenario-based design .', 'This article introduces Berkeley Integrated System for Transportation Optimization ( BISTRO ) , a new open source transportation planning decision support system that uses an agent-based simulation and optimization approach to anticipate and develop adaptive plan for possible technological disruption and growth scenario .', 'The new framework was evaluated in the context of a machine learning competition hosted within Uber Technologies , Inc. , in which over 400 engineer and data scientist participated .', 'For the purpose of this competition , a benchmark model , based on the city of Sioux Falls , South Dakota , was adapted to the BISTRO framework .', 'An important finding of this study was that in spite of rigorous analysis and testing done prior to the competition , the two top-scoring team discovered an unbounded region of the search space , rendering the solution largely uninterpretable for the purpose of decision-support .', 'On the other hand , a follow-on study aimed to fix the objective function .', "It served to demonstrate BISTRO 's utility as a human-in-the-loop cyberphysical system : one that uses scenario-based optimization algorithms as a feedback mechanism to assist urban planner with iteratively refining objective function and constraint specification on intervention strategy .", 'The portfolio of transportation intervention strategy alternative eventually chosen achieves high-level regional planning goal developed through participatory stakeholder engagement practice .', 'Achieving neuroplasticity in artificial neural network through smart city .', 'Through the Internet of thing ( IoT ) , as promoted by smart city , there is an emergence of big data accentuating the use of artificial intelligence through various component of urban planning , management , and design .', 'One such system is that of artificial neural network ( ANNs ) , a component of machine learning that boasts similitude with brain neurological network and its functioning .', 'However , the development of ANN was done in singular fashion , whereby process are rendered in sequence in a unidimensional perspective , contrasting with the function of the brain to which ANN boasts similitude , and in particular to the concept of neuroplasticity which encourages unique complex interaction in self-learning fashion , thereby encouraging more inclusive urban process and render urban coherence .', 'This paper takes inspiration from Christopher Alexander ’ s Nature of Order and dwells in the concept of complexity theory ; it also proposes a theoretical model of how ANN can be rendered with the same plastic property as brain neurological network with multidimensional interactivity in the context of smart city through the use of big data and its emerging complex network .', 'By doing so , this model caters to the creation of stronger , richer , and more complex pattern that support Alexander ’ s concept of “ wholeness ” through the connection of overlapping network .', 'This paper is aimed toward engineer with interdisciplinary interest looking at creating more complex and intricate ANN model , and toward urban planner and urban theorist working on the emerging contemporary concept of smart city .', 'ACM International Conference Proceeding the fragmentation of concrete ; and consideration of the paradigms of urban design teaching application about big data .', 'Generative growth with ‘ thin ’ globalization : Cambridge ’ s crossover model of innovation .', 'Change in leading-edge urban and regional development process and policy signify the rise of the ‘ Quaternary ’ or 4.0 Era of economic growth .', 'Few such space exist yet , but they have prodigious global reach from location like Cambridge ( as the exemplar here ) , Israel and Silicon Valley .', 'Their surface spread has led to the designation ‘ thin globalization ’ compared with ‘ thick ’ antecedent based on manufacturing and routine service .', 'Each display ‘ post-cluster ’ or ‘ platform ’ inter-connectivity and even early sign of ‘ de-globalization ’ via on-shoring of supplier .', 'Pioneer in ‘ crossover ’ innovation 4.0 platform evolution include ‘ flagship ’ corporation like FAGAMi ( Facebook , Apple , Google , Amazon and Microsoft ) .', 'These and other flagship acquire and site lab in proximity to Cambridge ’ s and other university research institutes and talent .', 'They work to what seems like a neoliberal ‘ Plan for the Future ’ in at least three case embedded in futuristic urban design utopias .', 'This further advantages innovation ‘ microsystems ’ like Cambridge and innovation ‘ macrosystems ’ like Silicon Valley that evolve diversified ‘ platform-clusters ’ of ‘ crossover ’ innovation flowing from interaction among microelectronic system , advanced mobility , machine learning , AI , robotics be mitigated healthcare .', 'The research problem is how can such extreme uneven growth polarization and .', 'Towards a deep learning powered query engine for urban planning .', 'Urban planning is crucial to sustainable growth .', 'In order for the planner to make informed decision , data from multiple source have to be retrieved and cross-referenced efficiently .', 'We discuss the implementation of a query engine which accepts natural language as input , using machine learning and NLP technique namely word embedding , CNN , rule-based system and NER to produce accurate output enriched with geographical insight to facilitate the planning process .', 'The query engine classifies the query into one of the planning domain , as well as determines the category , location and the size of buffer .', 'Processed result are presented on the ePlanner , which is a map service on the GIS implemented by the Urban Redevelopment Authority ( URA ) of Singapore .', 'Machine learning for real-time urban metric and design recommendation .', 'City are growing , becoming more complex , and changing rapidly .', 'Currently , community engagement for urban decision-making is often ineffective , uninformed , and only occurs in project ’ later stage .', 'To facilitate a more collaborative and evidence-based urban decision-making process for both expert and non-experts , real-time feedback and optimized suggestion are essential .', 'However , most of the current tool for urban planning are neither capable of performing complex simulation in real-time nor of providing guidance for better urban performance .', 'CityMatrix was introduced to address these challenge .', 'Machine learning technique were applied to achieve real-time prediction of multiple urban simulation , and thousand of city configuration were simulated .', 'The simulation result were used to train a convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to predict the traffic and solar performance of unseen city configuration .', 'The prediction with the CNN is thousand of time faster than the original simulation and maintains a high-quality representation of the result .', 'This machine learning approach was applied as a versatile , quick , accurate , and computationally efficient method not only for real-time feedback , but also for optimized design recommendation .', 'User involved in the evaluation of this project had a better understanding of the embodied trade-off of the city and achieved their goal in an efficient manner .', 'International series on information system and management in creative eMedia .', 'The proceeding contain 4 paper .', "The topic discussed include : concept of interactive machine learning in urban design problem ; tackling challenge in the engagement of citizen with smart city initiative ; squat & grow : designing smart human-food interaction in Singapore ; and Artur Lugmayr 's white paper collection and online resource .", 'An AI application to integrated tourism planning .', 'Integrated Tourism can be defined as the kind of tourism which is explicitly linked to the locality in which it takes place and , in practical term , has clear connection with local resource , activity , product , production and service industry , and a participatory local community .', 'In this paper we report our experience in applying Artificial Intelligence technique to Integrated Tourism planning in urban area .', 'In particular , we have modeled a domain ontology for Integrated Tourism and developed an Information Extraction tool for populating the ontology with data automatically retrieved from ['Artificial intelligence in urban forestry—A systematic review .', "Environmental quality and the citizen ' well-being largely depend on the urban forest .", 'But managing this natural capital is challenging for its biological complexity and interaction with other environmental , social , and economic aspect of the city .', 'In line with the current digital revolution with the rise of Smart Cities , the use of Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) is becoming more common , including in urban forestry .', 'In this systematic review , we evaluated 67 study on the interplay between AI and urban forestry surveyed on Science Direct and Scopus to provide an overview of the state of the art and identify new research avenue .', 'The sample includes study in 23 country and 85 city , including 5 megacities , comprising the remote assessment of canopy cover and specie distribution ; ecosystem service assessment ; management practice ; and socioeconomic aspect of urban forestry .', 'Most study focused on extant urban forest , with few example evaluating temporal trend , and only one focused on future scenario despite the predictive potential of AI .', 'A total of 22 AI method were employed in these study .', 'Only half of them point to clear advantage of the chosen method , such as robustness against missing data , overfitting , collinearity , non-linearity , non-normality , the combination of discrete and continuous variable , and higher accuracy .', 'The choice of these method depends on the various combination of aim , timescale , data type , and data source .', 'The application of AI in urban forestry is in full growth and will support decision making to improve livability in the city .', 'Classification of the influence of urban canyon geometry and reflectance on seasonal solar irradiation in three European city .', 'The study presents a methodological framework for simulating , analyzing and classifying the seasonal solar exposure and irradiation uniformity of symmetrical urban canyon in three European city with different latitude : Athens , Paris and Helsinki .', 'Parametric solar radiation simulation are conducted by varying the urban canyon geometry , orientation and surface reflectance .', 'The study proposes the Solar Irradiation Ratio ( SIR ) and develops a qualitative classification scheme for solar exposure and irradiation uniformity in order to compare simulation result from different city and label each urban canyon surface accordingly .', 'Finally , the study train and test Random Forest classifier which enable the quick classification of any symmetrical canyon geometry by providing canyon geometry , orientation and surface reflectance as input .', 'Testing reveals that the classifier have decent performance ( accuracy : 0.89 – 0.94 , precision : 0.82 – 0.92 ) and consequently may be used in early urban design and planning study to get a quick estimate of the solar performance of a given symmetrical urban canyon , before full-scale simulation take place .', 'High-resolution air temperature mapping in a data-scarce , arid area by mean of low-cost mobile measurement and machine learning .', 'The availability of gridded , screen-level air temperature data at an effective spatial and temporal resolution is important for many field such as climatology , ecology , urban planning and design .', 'This study aims at providing such data in a data-scarce , arid city within the greater Cairo region ( Egypt ) , namely the Sixth of October , where , to our knowledge , no such data are available .', 'By using ( i ) air temperature data , collected from mobile measurement , ( ii ) multiple spectral index , ( iii ) spatial analysis technique and ( iv ) random forest regression modelling , we produced air temperature map ( for both daytime and nighttime ) at 30-m spatial resolution for the entire city .', 'The proposed method is systematic and relies on low-cost instrumentation and freely-available satellite data and hence it can be replicated in similar data-scarce , arid area to allow for better spatial and temporal monitoring of air temperature .', 'Machine learning simulation of land cover impact on surface urban heat island surrounding park area .', 'The urban heat island effect has been studied extensively by many researcher around the world with the process of urbanization coming about as one of the major culprit of the increasing urban land surface temperature .', 'Over the past 20 year , the city of Dallas , Texas , has consistently been one of the fastest growing city in the United States and has faced rapid urbanization and great amount of urban sprawl , leading to an increase in built-up surface area .', 'In this study , we utilize Landsat 8 satellite image , Geographic Information System ( GIS ) technology , land use/land cover ( LULC ) data , and a state-of-the-art methodology combining machine learning algorithms ( eX-treme Gradient Boosted model , or XGBoost ) and a modern game theoretic-based approach ( Shap-ley Additive exPlanation , or SHAP value ) to investigate how different land use/land cover classi-fications impact the land surface temperature and park cooling effect in the city of Dallas .', 'We con-clude that green space , residential , and commercial/office space have the largest impact on Land Surface Temperatures ( LST ) as well as the Park ’ s Cooling Intensity ( PCI ) .', 'Additionally , we have found that the extent and direction of influence of these category depends heavily on the surrounding area .', 'By using SHAP values we can describe these interaction in greater detail than pre-vious study .', 'These result will provide an important reference for future urban and park place-ment planning to minimize the urban heat island effect , especially in sprawling city .', 'Change in the Urban Surface Thermal Environment of a Chinese Coastal City Revealed by Downscaling MODIS LST with Random Forest Algorithm .', 'Analysis of the formation and evolution of urban surface thermal environment is crucial for urban planning and improving the environment of a settlement .', 'Qingdao was selected in this study as a typical coastal city undergoing rapid urbanization , and the spatiotemporal dynamic characteristic of its urban surface thermal environment from 2010 to 2019 were evaluated .', 'The random forest ( RF ) algorithm was adopted to obtain its land surface temperature ( LST ) map with 30-m resolution by downscaling the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer ( MODIS ) LST product ; the remote sensing index emphasizing different land cover type , LST calculated by the radiative transfer equation , and elevation were used as input variable in the algorithm .', 'The heat island intensity ( HII ) , urban heat island ( UHI ) volume , and UHI grade were used to analyze the spatiotemporal dynamic characteristic of the urban surface thermal environment in Qingdao .', 'The result show an increasing trend in average HII between 1.1 and 2.52°C in the study area over the past 10 year .', 'The northern city appeared to have the highest UHI volume , while change of the UHI volume in Huangdao District of southwestern Qingdao was the most significant .', 'The area with high HII have gradually expanded during the last 10 year , and the area with a 10-yr persistently high HII are distributed mainly in old urban area with high building density and a dense population .', 'Different factor may influence UHI , such as artificial heat source , surface heat source , and hybrid heat source .', 'Finally , adjusting the urban structure , increasing the vegetated area , and changing building color are proposed to mitigate UHI in the area with continuously high HII .', 'Evaluating the role of urban fabric on surface urban heat island : The case of Istanbul .', 'Urban heat island , one of the fundamental anthropogenic impact on local climate , have been a growing concern especially for high-density urban area such as Istanbul .', 'This paper outlines the use of a supervised machine learning technique to understand the effect of the urban fabric on surface urban heat island ( SUHI ) formation in Istanbul , and identify effective variable to provide a basis for research and practice focusing on SUHI mitigation .', 'An analysis using the Ridge Regression Model found that 71 % of land surface temperature anomaly in Istanbul are linked to building coverage ratio ( BCR ) , surface/volume ratio ( SVR ) , sky-view factor ( SVF ) , canyon geometry factor ( CGF ) , and vegetation index ( NDVI ) .', 'NDVI and BCR were the urban fabric component with the highest contribution to SUHI formation , while the effect of SVF and CGF remained relatively low .', 'This research can help planner and designer gauge the contribution of the urban fabric to micro-climate issue and adapt SUHI mitigation strategy for project aiming to build climate-sensitive urban environment .', 'It also provides insight into and improves knowledge of supervised machine learning approach to the urban planning and design discipline .', 'Evaluation of the environmental impact of urbanization from the viewpoint of increased skin temperature : a case study from Istanbul , Turkey .', 'Urbanization is an inevitable process all around the world especially in developing country like Turkey .', 'Istanbul has been experiencing rapid urban expansion for the past 60 year .', 'This urban expansion is leading to the replacement of forest by various artificial surface .', 'This situation has a critical impact on the natural surface due to the alteration of heat energy balance .', 'In this study , the author tried to investigate the extent of urbanization of Istanbul within the past decade to unearth its impact on the urban heat island ( UHI ) severity and the level of its ecological consequence in term of decreased thermal comfort .', 'To this end , land use/cover ( LULC ) and land surface temperature ( LST ) map were generated using Landsat imagery based on random forest ( RF ) classifier ( as a machine learning tool ) and radiometric image processing algorithms , respectively , for four different date from 1989 to 2019 .', 'The statistical and spectral indicator were calculated for the study area to evaluate the association between urban development and UHI .', 'Result indicate that Istanbul has suffered a continuous land transformation from forest to urban and croplands so that the area of forest has diminished by 373.3 km2 , and the artificial surface have increased by 260 km2 .', 'Skin temperature over all the LULC classes show an increase during the study period with the highest value estimated over artificial surface .', 'The statistical analysis of urbanization indicator ( ULI , PD , UGSI , NDVI , and NDBI ) and UHI indicator ( UTFVI ) resulted in good correlation coefficient with the best agreement found between NDBI and UTFVI which stresses the strong link between the expansion of built-up area as a result of urbanization and the severity of UHI and its ecological impact in Istanbul .', 'Thus , it is a must for policy-makers and official of the city to take accurate measure regarding the urban planning to mitigate the harsh environmental impact of growing urbanization of Istanbul in upcoming year .', 'Assessing the cooling efficiency of urban park using data envelopment analysis and remote sensing data .', 'Urban park can contribute to significant cooling effect for the city microclimate and , therefore , promote urban resident ’ outdoor thermal comfort .', 'As the enhancement of the urban heat island effect , understanding the cooling efficiency of urban park and associated determinant has become critical for maximizing the ecological benefit of urban ecological infrastructure .', 'In this paper , we measured holistically the cooling efficiency of urban park from a relative and absolute perspective by using the data envelopment analysis ( DEA ) model and Landsat 8 OLI/TIRS satellite imagery .', 'We adopted two novel cooling effect index to rank and identify the inefficient park : DEA-based cooling efficiency index for relative efficiency and park cooling intensity index ( PCII ) for absolute efficiency .', 'A total of 146 urban park within the Shanghai metropolitan city was selected to conduct the empirical research .', 'The correlation analysis and machine learning technique ( XGBoost ) were also used to examine the relationship between the characteristic of park and two cooling effect index .', 'The finding revealed that the average cooling efficiency of urban park in summer was approximately 2.7 time higher than that in winter .', 'Park size and vegetation greenness ( NDVI ) were identified as the dominant factor for park cooling efficiency .', 'Moreover , larger park with area > 5 ha showed better cooling performance on average .', 'In the current study area , increasing the water body coverage ratio also played an important role on the improvement of cooling effect in both summer and winter .', 'The research finding could provide valuable reference for designing urban park and for urban planning to maximize the cooling benefit and mitigate the UHI effect .', 'Proposing an effective and inexpensive tool to detect urban surface temperature change associated with urbanization process in small city .', 'A consequence of urbanization is the loss of vegetation cover , replaced by urban area .', 'This study investigates the evolution of the built-up area and its influence on increasing the surface temperature through methodology applicable to small and medium-sized municipality where urbanization process monitoring is limited .', 'For the case study , the municipality of Penedo , located in the State of Alagoas , was selected .', 'Landsat-5 and Landsat-8 image were used to evaluate urban landscape through normalized difference vegetation index ( NDVI ) , normalized difference built-up index ( NDBI ) , and the land surface temperature ( LST ) .', 'A simple tool that summarizes NDBI and LST change was proposed - the Change Detection Index ( CDI ) .', "It was possible to highlight area where the increase in temperature is associated with the built area 's intensification .", 'Furthermore , the machine learning k-means clustering tool was applied to create group and analyze the relationship between urbanization and temperature increase , confirming the CDI value and validating this tool .', "An evident increase in the built area was highlighted by CDI and cluster analysis , indicating a heat island 's potential formation at the implantation area of a housing complex in the municipality .", 'The spatial analysis indicates priority area for intervention by a simple methodology that facilitated dialogue and understanding between stakeholder , associated with a low-cost tool with the potential for reproduction and adaptation , providing indicator to urban study and decision-makers and handle the lack of monitoring data in small and medium-sized municipality .', 'An Intelligent Tree Planning Approach Using Location-Based Social Networks Data .', 'How do we make sure that all citizen in a city have access to enough green space ?', 'An increasing part of the world ’ s population life in urban area , where contact with nature is largely reduced to street tree and park .', 'As optional tree planting site and financial resource are limited , determining the best planting site can be formulated as an optimization problem with constraint .', 'Can we locate these site based on the popularity of nearby venue ?', 'How can we ensure that we include group of people who tend to spend time in tree deprived area ?', 'Currently , tree location site are chosen based on criterion from spatial-visual , physical and biological , and functional category .', 'As these criterion do not give any insight into which citizen are benefiting from the tree placement , we propose new data-driven tree planting policy that take socio-cultural aspect as represented by the citizen ’ behavior into account .', 'We combine a Location Based Social Network ( LBSN ) mobility data set with tree location data set , both of New York City and Paris , as a case study .', 'The effect of four different policy is evaluated on simulated movement data and assessed on the average , overall exposure to tree as well as on how much inequality in tree exposure is mitigated .', 'Mapping essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) using geospatial big data : Progress , challenge , and opportunity .', 'Urban land use information that reflects socio-economic function and human activity is critically essential for urban planning , landscape design , environmental management , health promotion , and biodiversity conservation .', 'Land-use map outlining the distribution , pattern , and composition of essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) have facilitated a wide spectrum of application and further triggered new opportunity in urban study .', 'New and improved Earth observation , algorithms , and advanced product for extracting thematic urban information , in association with emerging social sensing big data and auxiliary crowdsourcing datasets , all together offer great potential to mapping fine-resolution EULUC from regional to global scale .', 'Here we review the advance of EULUC mapping research and practice in term of their data , method , and application .', 'Based on the historical retrospect , we summarize the challenge and limitation of current EULUC study regarding sample collection , mixed land use problem , data and model generalization , and large-scale mapping effort .', 'Finally , we propose and discuss future opportunity , including cross-scale mapping , optimal integration of multi-source feature , global sample library from crowdsourcing approach , advanced machine learning and ensembled classification strategy , open portal for data visualization and sharing , multi-temporal mapping of EULUC change , and implication in urban environmental study , to facilitate multi-scale fine-resolution EULUC mapping research .', 'Published by Taylor & Francis Group and Science Press on behalf of the International Society for Digital Earth , supported by the CASEarth Strategic Priority Research Programme .', 'Fine scale surface climate in complex terrain using machine learning .', 'Accurate and high spatial resolution ( < 100 m ) surface climate information is crucial for process-based modelling in hydrology , ecology , agriculture , urban study etc , especially in complex terrain landscape where coarse grid resolution information ( ∼10 km ) is inadequate to represent pronounced local variability .', 'We used a machine learning-based workflow to predict high resolution ( 30 m ) and sub-daily atmospheric variable field of near-surface air temperature and humidity , and wind speed .', 'The method used the Principal Component Analysis ( PCA ) decomposition applied on ground station observation or Global Climate Model ( GCM ) residual error , in a sequence with bias correction and statistical model ( Linear Regression-LR , Artificial Neural Network model-ANN and Empirical Quantile Mapping-EQM ) to provide downscaling from large scale atmospheric condition to complex terrain variability .', 'The prediction described relationship of Principal Component ( PC ) scores dependent on GCM temporal variability on 6-hourly basis ( with LR or ANN or EQM ) , and PC loadings dependent on topographic index to help providing horizontal sub-grid extrapolation .', 'The method were validated with a 1-year dataset from a dense weather station network deployed in a complex terrain basin in tropical climate of Southeast Brazil .', 'We present an exhaustive description of the PC modes daily/seasonal variability for each variable , and their spatial variability associated to the topography and thermal driven circulation .', 'The prediction in general substantially improved accuracy when compared to GCM output , especially near the valley and in sheltered area where local effect are mandatory .', 'Specially , ANN and EQM significantly improved the prediction at the variability of extreme event , such as the formation of strong cold air pooling or wetting in the valley .', 'Combining CityGML file and data-driven model for microclimate simulation in a tropical city .', 'This research first developed a solution to convert LOD 2 CityGML file to LOD 1 file .', 'Then , by using LOD 1 file as geometric input , this study developed a python-based microclimate simulation program based on a customized machine learning algorithm to better understand the relationship between urban morphology and outdoor temperature .', 'The integration with the 3D geometry makes this prediction model not only useful to the scientific research , but also as an urban planning tool for environmentally sustainable design .', 'For model development , meteorological data and urban morphology feature were used to predict the daily maximum temperature , daily minimum temperature , daily daytime average temperature and daily night-time average temperature .', 'Voting regression ( VOT ) based on ordinary least square and random forest was used as the regression model .', 'The average CV-R2 and the CV-RMSE predicted by VOT for the outdoor air temperature were 0.84 and 0.52°C .', 'Compared with ordinary least square , VOT improved R2 by an average of 18 % and RMSE by an average of 24 % .', 'Sensitivity analysis indicated the daytime temperature was inversely proportional to the aspect ratio of urban canyon street .', 'In tropical climate , greenery can be used as a cooling measure .', 'A negative logarithmic relationship was found between the daily maximum temperature , daily minimum temperature and green plot ratio .', 'This shows that as the green coverage increase , the cooling effect of greenery increase , and it is more effective to adopt greenery early in area with less vegetation .', 'Urban ambient air temperature estimation using hyperlocal data from smart vehicle-borne sensor .', 'High-quality temperature data at a finer spatio-temporal scale is critical for analyzing the risk of heat exposure and hazard in urban environment .', 'The variability of urban landscape makes city a challenging environment for quantifying heat exposure .', 'Most of the existing heat hazard study have inherent limitation on two front ; first , the spatio-temporal granularity are too coarse , and second , the inability to track the ambient air temperature ( AAT ) instead of land surface temperature ( LST ) .', 'Overcoming these limitation requires developing model for mapping the variability in heat exposure in urban environment .', 'We investigated an integrated approach for mapping urban heat hazard by harnessing a diverse set of high-resolution measurement , including both ground-based and satellite-based temperature data .', 'We mounted vehicle-borne mobile sensor on city bus to collect high-frequency temperature data throughout 2018 and 2019 .', 'Our research also incorporated key biophysical parameter and Landsat 8 LST data into Random Forest regression modeling to map the hyperlocal variability of heat hazard over area not covered by the bus .', 'The vehicle-borne temperature sensor data showed large temperature difference within the city , with the largest variation of up to 10 °c and morning-afternoon diurnal change at a magnitude around 20 °C .', 'Random Forest modeling on noontime ( 11:30 am – 12:30 pm ) data to predict AAT produced accurate result with a mean absolute error of 0.29 °c and successfully showcased the enhanced granularity in urban heat hazard mapping .', 'These map revealed well-defined hyperlocal variability in AAT , which were not evident with other research approach .', 'Urban core and dense residential area revealed larger than 5 °C AAT difference from their nearby green space .', 'The sensing framework developed in this study can be easily implemented in other urban area , and finding from this study will be beneficial in understanding the heat vulnerability of individual community .', 'It can be used by the local government to devise targeted hazard mitigation effort such as increasing green space , developing better heat-safety policy , and exposure warning for worker .', 'Identifying tree trait for cooling urban heat islands—a cross-city empirical analysis .', 'Research Highlight : This paper presents a cross-city empirical study on micro-climatic thermal benefit of urban tree , using machine-learning analysis to identify the importance of several in situ measured tree physiognomy trait for cooling .', 'Background and Objective : Green infrastructure and tree in particular play a key role in mitigating the urban heat island ( UHI ) effect .', 'A more detailed understanding of the cooling potential of urban tree and specific tree trait is necessary to support tree management decision for cooling our progressively hot city .', 'The goal of this study was to identify the influence and importance of various tree trait and site condition .', 'Material and Method : Surface temperature , air temperature at 1.1 m and at tree crown height , as well as wet bulb globe-temperature of shaded and fully sun-exposed reference area , were used to study the cooling effect of seven different urban tree specie .', 'For all 100 individual , tree height , crown base , trunk circumference , crown volume , crown area , leaf area index ( LAI ) and leaf area density ( LAD ) were measured .', 'Measurement were conducted in the city of Dresden , Salzburg , Szeged , and Vienna as representative for middle European city in different climate zone .', 'Result : Beside site condition , tree specie , height , height of crown base , as well as trunk circumference , have a great influence on the cooling effect for city dweller .', 'The trunk circumference is a very valuable indicator for estimating climate regulating ecosystem service and therefore a highly robust estimator for policy maker and tree management practitioner when planning and managing urban green area for improving the availability and provision of ecosystem service .', 'The effect of 3D architectural pattern on the urban surface temperature at a neighborhood scale : Relative contribution and marginal effect .', 'Urban architecture is an important contributor to urban heat island ( UHI ) effect .', 'Yet thorough investigation into how three-dimensional ( 3D ) architectural pattern influence urban thermal condition collectively and individually are limited .', 'This study bridges this gap by adopting a machine learning method , boosted regression tree ( BRT ) , to analyze the relative influence and marginal effect of 3D urban architecture on land surface temperature ( LST ) .', 'Ten architectural metric are incorporated to describe the composition and configuration of 3D architectural pattern at a neighborhood scale in the typical megacity of Shanghai .', 'The result show that in summer , the building coverage ratio ( BCR ) , mean architecture height ( MAH ) , mean architecture height standard deviation ( AHSD ) and mean architecture projection area ( MAPA ) are the most influential factor , with relative contribution of 39.3 % , 16.5 % , 12.3 % and 10.4 % , respectively .', 'The regulation amplitude ( ΔT ) of the dominant metric for the neighborhood average LST temperature are 2.7 °C , 0.9 °C , 0.6 °C , and 0.6 °C , respectively .', 'Moreover , with the LST , the BCR exhibits a monotonic positive correlation , the MAH and AHSD show a stepwise negative correlation , and the MAPA shows a combination of positive and negative correlation .', 'It is generally recommended to decrease the development intensity and architectural base area , while increase the building height and roughness to improve the urban thermal condition at the neighborhood scale .', 'The dominant contributor and related marginal effect are generally consistent across different season .', 'These finding can provide quantitative insight for mitigating the LST effect via rational design and management of 3D architectural pattern .', 'Given the distinctive insight provided , the BRT method is recommended for disentangling the relationship between LST and environmental variable in upcoming study .', 'Pattern of historical and future urban expansion in Nepal .', 'Globally , urbanization is increasing at an unprecedented rate at the cost of agricultural and forested land in peri-urban area fringing larger city .', 'Such land-cover change generally entails negative implication for societal and environmental sustainability , particularly in South Asia , where high demographic growth and poor land-use planning combine .', 'Analyzing historical land-use change and predicting the future trends concerning urban expansion may support more effective land-use planning and sustainable outcome .', "For Nepal 's Tarai region-a populous area experiencing land-use change due to urbanization and other factors-we draw on Landsat satellite imagery to analyze historical land-use change focusing on urban expansion during 1989-2016 and predict urban expansion by 2026 and 2036 using artificial neural network ( ANN ) and Markov chain ( MC ) spatial model based on historical trend .", 'Urban cover quadrupled since 1989 , expanding by 256 km2 ( 460 % ) , largely as small scattered settlement .', 'This expansion was almost entirely at the expense of agricultural conversion ( 249 km2 ) .', 'After 2016 , urban expansion is predicted to increase linearly by a further 199 km2 by 2026 and by another 165 km2 by 2036 , almost all at the expense of agricultural cover .', "Such unplanned loss of prime agricultural land in Nepal 's fertile Tarai region is of serious concern for food-insecure country like Nepal .", 'Evaluating multivariable statistical method for downscaling nighttime land surface temperature in urban area .', 'For research and practice in field such as the environment and meteorology , nighttime land surface temperature ( LST ) images at fine resolution provide important basic data .', 'Since only a few satellite sensor can take fine-resolution thermal infrared image at night , such image are rather scarce .', 'Downscaling of coarse-resolution LST images is a potential method for obtaining high-resolution LST image .', 'However , downscaling method have been mostly proposed for daytime LST image .', 'This study aimed to evaluate the performance of method that combine multiple explanatory variable and machine learning algorithms for downscaling coarse-resolution nighttime LST image in urban area .', 'Verification showed that the error in the downscaling result were acceptable ( mean absolute error within 2 K ) .', 'The resulting image could depict the spatial pattern of night LST in the study area in great detail .', 'It was demonstrated that visible-near infrared image taken in the daytime could be used for downscaling of nighttime LST image , the rationality of which was deduced .', 'It was also demonstrated that the performance of the spectral explanatory variable in nighttime LST downscalingwas not lower than that of the mechanism explanatory variable .', 'This method has high application value in many academic and practical effort , such as land-atmosphere interface radiation budget study , suitability assessment of human settlement , and urban environmental planning .', 'Turning down the heat : An enhanced understanding of the relationship between urban vegetation and surface temperature at the city scale .', 'Guiding urban planner on the cooling return of different configuration of urban vegetation is important to protect urban dweller from adverse heat impact .', 'To this end , we estimated statistical model that fused multi-temporal very fine spatial ( 20 cm ) and vertical ( 1 mm ) resolution imagery , that captures the complexity of urban vegetation , with remotely sensed temperature data to assess how urban vegetation configuration influence urban temperature .', 'Perth , Western Australia , was used as a case-study for this analysis .', 'Panel regression model showed that within a location an increase in tree and shrub cover has a larger cooling effect than grass coverage .', 'On average , holding all else equal , an approximate 1 km 2 increase in shrub ( tree ) cover within a location reduces surface temperature by 12 °c ( 5 °C ) .', 'We included a range of robustness check for the observed relationship between urban vegetation type and temperature .', 'Geographically weighted regression model showed spatial variation in the cooling effect of different vegetation type ; this indicates that i ) unobserved factor moderate temperature-vegetation relationship across urban landscape , and ii ) that urban vegetation type and temperature relationship are complex .', 'Machine learning model ( Random Forest ) were used to further explore complex and non-linear relationship between different urban vegetation configuration and temperature .', 'The Random Forests showed that vegetation type explained 31.84 % of the out-of-bag variance in summer surface temperature , that increased cover of large vegetation within a location increases cooling , and that different configuration of urban vegetation structure can lead to cooling gain .', 'The model in this study were trained with vegetation data capturing local detail , multiple time-periods , and entire city coverage .', 'Thus , these model illustrate the potential to develop locally-detailed and spatially explicit tool to guide planning of vegetation configuration to optimise cooling at local- and city-scales .', 'Estimation of daily maximum and minimum air temperature in urban landscape using MODIS time series satellite data .', 'Urban air temperature is considered a significant variable for a variety of urban issue , and analyzing the spatial pattern of air temperature is important for urban planning and management .', 'However , insufficient weather station limit accurate spatial representation of temperature within a heterogeneous city .', 'This study used a random forest machine learning approach to estimate daily maximum and minimum air temperature ( Tmax and Tmin ) for two megacities with different climate characteristic : Los Angeles , USA , and Seoul , South Korea .', 'This study used eight time-series land surface temperature ( LST ) data from Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer ( MODIS ) , with seven auxiliary variable : elevation , solar radiation , normalized difference vegetation index , latitude , longitude , aspect , and the percentage of impervious area .', 'We found different relationship between the eight time-series LSTs with Tmax/Tmin for the two city , and designed eight scheme with different input LST variable .', 'The scheme were evaluated using the coefficient of determination ( R2 ) and Root Mean Square Error ( RMSE ) from 10-fold cross-validation .', 'The best scheme produced R2 of 0.850 and 0.777 and RMSE of 1.7 °c and 1.2 °C for Tmax and Tmin in Los Angeles , and R2 of 0.728 and 0.767 and RMSE of 1.1 °c and 1.2 °C for Tmax and Tmin in Seoul , respectively .', 'LSTs obtained the day before were crucial for estimating daily urban air temperature .', 'Estimated air temperature patterns showed that Tmax was highly dependent on the geographic factor ( e.g.', ', sea breeze , mountain ) of the two city , while Tmin showed marginally distinct temperature difference between built-up and vegetated area in the two city .', 'Microsite condition dominate habitat selection of the red mason bee ( Osmia bicornis , Hymenoptera : Megachilidae ) in an urban environment : A case study from Leipzig , Germany .', 'The red mason bee ( Osmia bicornis L. ) is a common wild bee in urban environment which contributes to early-season pollination .', 'We know only little about how any specie of wild bee in city responds to resource distribution or landscape structure and the urban habitat ( s ) that they prefer .', 'We employed a citizen science approach to investigate driver behind the spatial distribution of this solitary bee in the urban region of Leipzig ( Germany ) .', 'Volunteer hung trap nest at different location and collected information on eight local , microsite condition ( such as sun exposure , attachment position , local flower availability ) .', 'We derived 14 landscape factor from a digital GIS biotope data map ( e.g .', 'distance to flower site and urban matrix property such as size and edge length of patch ) .', 'Both occurrence and abundance of O. bicornis were then analyzed using a combination of machine learning and multiple ( logistic ) regression .', 'The result indicate that the red mason bee is ubiquitous in urban area but clearly profit from nearby floral resource .', 'Although we expected a balanced influence of landscape factor and microsite condition , we found that hang location of the trap nest was most important , followed by sun exposure .', 'City with many fine-scaled floral resource ( such as private garden but not park ) and an open housing structure with higher sun exposure between building provide a good environment for cavity-nesting bee such as O. bicornis .', 'In place without suitable nesting opportunity , artificial nest can support the bee .']

['Predicting citywide distribution of air pollution using mobile monitoring and three-dimensional urban structure .', 'Understanding relationship between urban structure pattern and air pollutant is key to sustainable urban planning .', 'In this study , we employ a mobile monitoring method to collect PM2.5 and BC data in the city of Philadelphia , PA during the summer of 2019 and apply the Structure of Urban Landscapes ( STURLA ) methodology to examine relationship between urban structure and atmospheric pollution .', 'We find that PM2.5 and BC vary by STURLA class , and some class exhibit significant difference in pollution concentration .', 'We also find that the proportion in which STURLA component are present throughout the urban landscape can be used to predict the spatial distribution of urban air pollution .', 'Among frequently sampled STURLA class , gpl ( grass , pavement , and low-rise building ) hosted the highest PM2.5 concentration on average ( 16.60 ± 4.29 µg/m3 ) , while tgbwp ( tree , grass , bare soil , water , pavement ) hosted the highest BC concentration ( 2.31 ± 1.94 µg/m3 ) .', 'Furthermore , STURLA combined with machine learning modeling was able to correlate PM2.5 ( R2= 0.68 , RMSE 2.82 µg/m3 ) and BC ( R2 = 0.64 , RMSE 0.75 µg/m3 ) concentration with urban landscape composition and interpolate concentration throughout the city .', 'These result demonstrate the efficacy of the STURLA methodology in modeling relationship between air pollution and urban structure pattern .', 'Urban soils as a spatial indicator of quality for urban socio-ecological system .', 'The development of criterion and indicator to quantify the transition to sustainability of the urban socio-ecological system quality is determinant for planning policy and
